Delivery is pretty swift, I think. I live about 20 minutes away, and my order always shows up in 45 minutes to an hour. Pretty fast for a place so far away. 
Food holds up pretty well in delivery, since they use those thermal pizza bags.

Update: I actually have to tell myself, no Heather, you can't order a meatball stromboli today, it's that good. I get cravings for it! I've converted everyone in my house to Biaggios; when that stromboli arrives it's like a throwing bread at a flock of ducks. It's gone within minutes. Everybody likes the pizza too, but the stromboli's so damn good that we almost always end up getting that instead.

I went to this place thinking I could split a sandwich with my significant other. Instead we got something that looked nothing like what they advertised. You robbed me $12. I urge you to remedy this situation.

FINALLY a pizza place in Vegas that takes pride in what they create. I ordered a large supreme with meatballs spinach and pineapple. Lady on the phone was lovely. Delivery was Fast. Delivery guy was friendly. In fact, technically he delivered to me after they closed. Impressive. The ingredients were like straight from the farmers market. There is genuinely zero reason to order from some generic Pizza Hut, dominoes, papa johns with a place like this in your neighborhood. Outstanding!
Delicious pizza, NY style and well priced. Great deal for two slices and a drink for $7.99. Garlic lots was tasty also and HUGE! Perfect place to carbload.

I am going to have to agree with some of the other reviews on this page....over priced. We ordered a veggie (medium) and meat lovers (large). Total: $44.00 That is pretty outrageous to me because I did not feel the pizza was anything special. The ingredients on the veggie pizza were good but it was soggy.

The owner is soooo nice! I told him I found his pizza place on this app & that I was visiting from Colorado & he just seemed like my favorite uncle happy to welcome me to his home. I loaded up my GF pizza with toppings and I SERIOUSLY COULD NOT STOP EATING IT!! Soooooooo good! I asked if I could have my pizza cooked a bit longer so the crust would be crunchy and the owner's employee asked if it it was  dark enough & if I wanted it cooked longer - how nice! I had it cooked just a bit longer because I had ordered juicy pineapple (and pepperoni & onions & green peppers & ricotta cheese - I told you I made a loaded pizza!!!). I planned on only eating 1/2 and I ate all but a slice and 1/2! What a treat to eat gluten free pizza on vacation!

I wish I would have read the reviews and seen the pics before I decided to order dinner. We ordered wings, fingers, fries and a cheese pizza. The pizza was good and I wish I would have just ordered that. Everything was overpriced for what you get, also not so good. The chicken tastes like Tyson frozen chicken. You get 3 tiny fingers with no fries for 7.99. The wings (which are totally overbreaded) are sold $1 each. Again, no fries. Neither came with a meal option so I ordered an order of fries at 3.99 figuring we could share, wow the order was small! The fries have that slight breading FYI. Glad we ordered a large pizza as I ended up not finishing my wings.

Today was my 2nd time ordering and the pizza was just okay. Slightly to sweet for my tastes. Today my pizza was greasy and just wet. All the toppings fell off my pizza when I tried to eat it. When I took my first bite I bit into something super hard. Yikes! Had to spit out that bite. Great flavor on the cheese and pepperoni though. To me the pizza needed to be baked longer and I did to give it a crisper crust but for myself I didn't want it. I also ordered wings and fried mushrooms. The wings were nice and crispy which was great and they came unsauced. I loved that I could sauce them myself so they never got soggy. The fried mushrooms had great flavor but for the price you don't get many. Overall 3/5 for me because of the pizza. I want more flavor in the crust and a more stable pizza. It was like a meh experience for me. The other things I ordered were great but I won't order the pizza again. But would try other food.

My pregnant wife was craving for a really good pizza last week. So, she started looking at yelp and saw all the good reviews for Biaggio's... So, we were off to try it out. First, we noticed a very friendly and knowledgeable server (who turned out to be the owner- Biaggio). He told us about the quality of the ingredients and how the secrets of the preparation were handed down from family... The hype was so much :) Happily, the pizza was as good as the hype! It's the freshest, tastiest, and best pizza we've ever had. We can never go back to Pizza Hut, Papa John's or Woodfired Pizza. When it is hot and fresh, it is absolutely delicious. You can tell the quality of the ingredients! We had the Supreme Pizza(yummy)... also tried the Garlic Knots (amazing!!!) and finished it off with his addicting signature dessert (Zeppole)... Can't wait to have it again :)

Our family has always loved Biaggio's pizza. Tonight after an exhausting day I got a pizza delivered and when I opened the box after brining it inside I tried pulling the slices apart and the cheese had slid together. Could easily have happened at any point and I understand things happen. I called and let them know and Biaggio's said to eat what we could and he would have another sent over. Not only did a fresh pizza arrive but also a gift certificate. Amazing customer service. I was not expecting to get a gift certificate. Great people and great food.

Awesome fresh food made to order, clean establishment, great service, great prices. I highly recommend this place, I will be ordering from here again. Had the white pizza with pepperoni and the cheese steak with all extras, can't wait to try everything else.
We came in for lunch. It was really good food. Garlic knots are the BOMB!!!!! We will come back for sure. Service was good too.

Love this place! Amazing pizza! Great people! Biaggio himself came over and chatted with us. He is a wonderful man! He even spoiled us with a free fried dough dessert because I'm pregnant.  My friend had a meatball parm sub that she loved. Definately check this place out and keep going back for more! Places like this with the whole package of great food, nice people, good prices... are few and far between!

We have tried almost everything on the menu and have never been disappointed. We eat here at least once a month. The food is always fresh and the service is second to none. My favorites are the meat lovers pizza and the veggie salad. On the off chance your food is not 100 percent to your satisfaction, let them know and they WILL make sure you leave happy. They really are all about the customers here.

1st time order:
pineapple white pizza
delicious
over an hour for delivery but was told 40-45 minutes, so when pizza was delivereed it was cold. No biggie, didn't call and complain, just ate it and enjoyed it.

2nd order:
Told the guy that last time since they went to the other side of the complex where I lived, to call me first so I could explain directions. He PROMISED he'd call. Dude shows up, without calling, and delivered a HORRIBLE pie. Sure, it tasted good, but it looked like the pizza was on a roller coaster. The cheese "slid" to one side, the pie was completely soggy, so you couldn't enjoy the crust. 

Not going to bother giving them my business again. It's a shame though too because the pie itself was good. But the service and delivery are awful. AW freakin FUL!

Saturday night and the family wanted pizza. We headed over to Biaggio's to see what all the hype was about and it didn't disappoint. We walked in, were greeted by Biaggio (the owner) and his staff and grabbed a seat. We ordered a medium supreme pizza and a slice of cheese pizza for my two year old. While waiting they brought out a complimentary meatball and some bread. The meatball was amazing -- made in-house with a mixture of pork, veal, and some other stuff I don't remember.

The wait for the pizza took a little while and when Biaggio checked on our order he found out that they made a meat lovers pizza by mistake. He came out and apologized and said that he would bring it out so we could munch on it while our correct order was being made. The meat lovers pizza was delicious, filled with house made sausage and bacon. Our supreme came out a short time after and that pizza was equally amazing. One of the best pizza crusts I've ever had. Despite all the cheese and sauce the crust remained crispy. That's something other pizzerias fail at.

They boxed up the pizza we couldn't finish and on our way out they thanked us for coming and said if it wasn't a five-star experience he'd make it one next time. While I don't normally like it when businesses solicit stellar reviews from customers, the food and service was so good that I can't give them anything less than top marks. Now that Ciao Ciao is closed this will no doubt be our go-to pizza joint.

Wow, the garlic knots are to die for. Buttery, lots of garlic, dipped into marinara sauces topped with Parmesan...heavenly...Yum Yum Yum.  This is a solid 5 star appetizer.  I wouldn't mind making this my main entree. (5*)

But:
Pizza w/the following toppings: pineapple, anchovy, bacon, ham, jalapeno-We feel like there wasn't enough cheese...it was ok.  um, maybe because of the combination that we chose...will try something else next time.  (3*)

Dozen of wings, extra well done, with sauces on the side-when this came out, it was battered fried, and we realized that we like them wings naked fried vs. battered fried.  I tried one wing and couldn't eat more. (2*)

Mr. Biaggio is a really friendly owner.  Roland really wanted to try the meatball, but didn't see that he can order it on the side.  He asked Mr. Biaggio, and Mr. Biaggio actually let us sample a big meatball w/slices of fresh baguette.  We enjoyed that meatball very much.  Service (5*)

Next time, we will get the best garlic knots we have ever tasted, and the meatball sandwich.

Overall #*s/4=3.75~4.0

Soooo good.  We ordered cheese pizza...they gave us more than we ordered...it was fantastically delicious.  Two things I would like to see change if possible...it was super cheesy but I'd like a bit more sauce on it and it was very salty.

Amazing!!! I ordered the meat calzone and it was by far the best calzone I have ever had. The dough was light and the ingredients perfect. Can not wait till I can come back for something else on the menu.

I read the reviews and saw this place had 4.5 stars so we decided to give it a try. The customer service was good and they were very attentive that's why I gave them three stars, otherwise this could've easily been two. The garlic knots were drenched in oil and the pizza was average at best.

Food was good but was blown away by how they charge $.99 a wing, I needed up getting g two meatball subs, 6 garlic knots and 30 wings . Total came out to $65. 

  My only advice is to make sure you really want wings if that's what you order, better off going to wing stop.
Ordered a half white and half sausage/jalapeños pizza, white was good but a little flat in taste the sausage was amazing!  The zeppole were plentiful and delicious little pillows of love!  Yummy!!

Once again it's time for our business trip to Las Vegas and Biaggio's Pizza is a must have while we're here.  The Garlic Knots are to die for.  Soft with a lovely crust, mouthwatering garlic butter and the freshest marinara I've ever had.  We ordered a large Supreme Pizza, even though there's just the two of us.  Leftovers are heaven!  Hot, cheesy, the toppings were as fresh as they get.  This place is wonderful and we can always count on a delicious experience whenever we're here.  Thanks Biaggio's!

We took delivery. Kids ate it all. They are pretty vocal and they said it was excellent.

I didn't care for it so much. It was a good pizza, but not great.

Delivery took almost an hour, but the pizza arrived lukewarm and the crust lost it's crispiness and the cheese went a little soggy.

At $60 for a medium pizza and two smalls tax and delivery surcharge, I expected more.

Love this place! We tried it a few weeks ago & have been back twice. We ate in and ordered take out-both pleasant experiences. Side salad, wings & pizza were all great. Staff is always really nice. I recommend checking this place out or using it as your go-to takeout. (Or both)

Biaggio's Pizzeria makes good pizza, something that seems to be an art (although I don't know why). 

They are not the best pizza in town and they are definitely not the best value.

Biaggio's is the kind of place where people, who have more money than sense, make a big deal about their za. It tastes good yes, but do I really need to pay $25 for a two topping pizza?

I'll probably eat there again, but it will need to be one of those "I feeling rich enough to toss a fiver at Steve Wynn and thank him for his hotel" kind of moments.
Family owned business, clean, friendly, just plain great. The kicker is, the food is amazing too. Where can you find that anymore?

I come into this place often when i'm on lunch break from work. the owner is extremely generous and makes my experience much more enjoyable. I definitely would recommend this amazing restaurant to anyone looking for good pizza!

Loved this place. First off, the service was awesome. Mr. Biaggio was so kind to us. 
We had a slice of pepperoni and Hawaiian pizza, chicken wings (plain with medium on the side) and a house salad. Everything was soooo delicious. Wings were super crunchy, the pizza was awesome. I would prefer a little More sauce on the pizza and perhaps romaine lettuce instead of iceberg, but that doesn't change the fact that this place is great. I can't even explain how well we were treated.
Check them out when you have a chance~
Cute & quaint spot. Delicious pizza served in a friendly atmosphere. I can't wait to try the other items on the menu!
Best pizza in Vegas! I love the crust it's so crispy and they give lot's of toppings! Great prices and great service. Everything is fresh and it's very clean. You must try it, you won't be sorry.

Their Buffalo Mozzarella cheese with Italian Sausage on their classic crust is pure heaven 

Quality pizza, good service, family owned

Great pizza for takeout. Love the veggie pizza and the meat lovers. Great crust, sweet tomato sauce. They are not skimpy on the toppings. Garlic knots were really really good. I also really loved the chicken wings with the hot sauce....my lips felt it for a while.

For take out and very decent prices (well at least compared to San Francisco prices) you cannot beat Biaggio's
We were visiting Las Vegas from Utah and wanted to try a good pizza place. We chose Biaggios cause of the good reviews. We were definitely impressed. Food was awesome and the service was even better!

My wife and I shared a Stromboli that we ordered to go.  The service was excellent, the quality of ingredients was above average and we would strongly recommend Biaggio's to anyone.  Often you go to some of those smaller establishments and the food looks good but has no flavor.  I was very happy that wasn't tue here.  Thanks for the good food and timely service.

Walked in with elderly Uncle after hearing aids check next door. Uncle is from Philadelphia, pizza and meatball subs are an issue for debate in his family. We had lunch special, 2 slice pizza and meatball sub with drink. Excellent! Uncle was delighted. Clean, great service, had cannoli for dessert, excellent!

You have to love Yelp.  I've lived in Las Vegas for decades, and tried this little neighborhood gem for the first time based on Yelp's reviews.  Biaggio's is about a mile and a half from my residence.  From the outside it looks like so many other mom and pop pizza joints that are sprinkled thoughout the city.  But once you walk in the door, you notice that this restaurant is different.  The place sparkles with pride of ownership, and I was greeted by it's owner with a smile and a handshake when I walked in the door.  

A glass display case in at the register displays the samples of food that they offer in a very appealing way, that makes you want to order them all.  There are tables both inside and outside the restaurant, that almost makes the small eating area look large.  The place isn't elaborate, but the tables and chairs are clean and solidly built, and floor looks like you could use the three second rule if food was dropped.

We ordered the chicken wings with blue cheese dressing, and a meatball parm sub.

The wings (10) were crispy, fairly small, and not overly greasy. On a scale of 1 to ten I'd give them a solid 8.  They were filling, tasty, and I'd order them again.  The meatball parm sandwich was good, but not great.  The meatballs were huge, and covered with an abundance of cheese.  On a scale of one to ten, I'd rate them a 7.5.  the roll was toasted, good, but not great.  It was a very filling.

Would I go back there again... A definite yes.  Great food for a football crowd on a Sunday afternoon.  Thanks Yelp for steering me here.

One of my favorite places to eat. Staff is outstanding and the owner takes pride in his shop. It shows. I usually order a standard pepperoni and the ingredients are high quality. I sometimes order the gluten free pizza for my family when they are in town and even that's delicious. The only con is that they don't have large  gluten free pizzas, only medium. 

Still a 10 out of 10 for me.

Very good first experience. Had garlic knots, Greek salad and the a large pie.  Portions are huge. Ranch dressing is very tasty.  Service is fantastic.  Resturant is clean.  I recommend this place for very good pizza. Will be back soon.

Amazing pizza and even better customer service! This will become a regular on our rotation for sure. Kids loved it, parents loved it; a winner all around. The garlic knots were seasoned perfectly and the dough was perfectly soft. Can't wait to come back!!

3.5stars...

I was craving chicken wings tonight during a Netflix marathon but was too lazy to get out of the house so I turned to yelp for some help. 

Chicken wings: 
Ordered 30 wings. These wings are so good! Fried and juicy without being too oily. They arrived hot and crispy with sauces on the side. 
Garlic knots: 
I'd pass on these. We ordered an order of 6 and only finished 1. 
Fries: 
Nothing special...
White pizza slice w/ mushrooms: 
Underwhelming to say the least. It tasted as if it was left out all day. The slice was cardboard-like. The cheese reminded me of rubber. I tried reheating it in the oven but it didn't help much. 

The chicken wings were absolutely delicious but everything else was disappointing. I have a feeling that the wings may have held up the order which would explain why everything else arrived cold. The order came out to $50 before tip. 

Overall, I'm happy with the order.  My cravings for good wings was satisfied and I got to finish an entire season of House of Cards without leaving the house.

This is real east coast pizza with fresh real ingredients. The sausage is made from scratch and the dough on the pizza is out of this world. We live in Henderson and this pizza is so good worth the trip. He does delivery to Henderson as well but we love going in. The owner is always happy to see us and it is such a great feeling knowing how he really cares about what he serves and the service. This place is wonderful. I would give it 100 stars if I could.

The food is delish! Their pizzas were far superior to any others I've had here in Vegas. Their chicken wings and garlic knots could both become my new addictions! 

Also, the service and customer interaction was perfection, which seems to be a detail that is all too overlooked in life! Biaggio himself is such a wonderful host that he makes you feel like family rather than a customer. Also, they deliver ALL over town, yes ALL over!

I sure hope they open another location near my Southwest home so I not only get the yummy food, but the awesome Biaggio experience!
The stromboli and garlic knots were really good and the portions were huge! The owner was really nice, and I will be going back for sure!

We ordered delivery from this place and were told it would be 45 minutes to an hour wait. An hour and 5 minutes later I called to check the status of our delivery. I was informed that the lady who took my order passed it along and the guy who took it from her set it aside, and that they were wall to wall cleaning so not taking any orders. The man apologized and offered a store credit, but we are not from here and were leaving the next morning. Not impressed since they had my contact information and could have called immediately to say there had been a mistake and they could not take any orders that night.

For 25 years I have been a Metro Pizza snob...until today. Biaggio's is pizza perfection. Cheesy, crispy, melty goodness. We had a meatball, pepperoni and mushroom and it was to-die-for delicious. The caesar salad is simple and tasty, and our order of zucchini chips were made in-house. They have a lot of gluten-free options, and THEY WILL DELIVER TO MOUNTAIN'S EDGE for a pittance of a delivery fee ($4). To top it all off, the owner greeted us and thanked us for visiting, and he sat and chatted with us while we enjoyed his amazing food. Our server was a doll, also.  I am sooooo on this train!

I was trying to recreate a pizza experience I had at a different place. Saying to myself if I copy the ingredients and toppings surely the flavor will be similar right? Wrong. If I were starving and there was nothing else available to eat this pizza would be a godsend. Fortunately for me I am not starving unfortunately for me I ordered this pizza blah blah blah
We decided to give this place another try. We ordered a pizza and it turned out pretty good! The dough/bread tasted fresh and it didn't have an old aroma/texture to it this time. Thanks!

After trying pizza places all over town we have finally found the freshest, most flavorful pizza in town! The crust is amazing and the toppings are so fresh! Great customer service too. Can't wait to come back. Plus they deliver!!!
Awesome pizza got to go back again! High on my recommend list of best Pizza joints to visit. The Pizza was great the service was awesome thumbs in my book!

I really liked it. They use fresh stuff and the guy is so friendly.
I like italian pizza so i was so happy with that.

A-W-E-S-O-M-E!! Great food! Great service! Biaggio is the sweetest man! They totally accommodated our party of 20 tonight (a week night) and everyone was super happy! We will definitely come back to this place!  

FYI: it's a GREAT place for sport teams to eat!

I stopped by to get a couple of slices and a drink... I'm happy I did! 
This is simply the best tasting pizza you will find anytime soon. The crust had a crispy almost crunchy texture, the sauce was homemade with no added sugar and the entire pizza was cooked perfect. 
We went again today and tried the meatballs and also the Philly. The bread on the Philly was fresh and toasted, the meat was not oily or dry and the whole sandwich was very good. 

The meatballs... Don't tell my wife, (she is Italian and loves to cook) but they were better than homemade. They were moist and you could actually taste the Parmesan and the garlic...delicious! 

UPDATE: 3/20/2011 
We returned here because we were craving a great pizza and it appears there have been some changes at Biaggio's. Here's the skinny: 

1. It appears they are acquiring their crust from a new source. Usually, the crust is rolled thin and cooks crispy and has a good flavor. This pizza had a crust that appeared to have been rolled, and waited too long rising to be made into a crust. It contained excess amounts of flower which made it taste burnt even though it was undercooked. I also ordered a calzone just to sample how it was prepared. It turned out to be simply another over flowered too thick pizza crust that was folded and pinched on the ends. Again, it tasted burnt and appeared burnt, even though it was under cooked as the cheese was not entirely melted inside. 

I am only downgrading my rating from a 5 to a 3 instead of a 2 because the staff is very friendly, and the dining area and bathroom was clean. I know Mr. Biaggio can do better. It was great the first time we were there.

Just ate there. We like to try places we can't get in Indy.  The owner was ver gracious and welcoming. Gave us some perks.  The food was great. Try the garlic knots. We had spaghetti, pizza and chicken Philly. All was great. You have to check this place out

once i tried this place i fell instantly in love. if you do decide to come to this pizza place i highly recommend to get the "white pizza" with sausage. its amazing! personally i hate really thin pizzas and love this place but its not too thin like other places that i tried. also their caesar salad is fresh and they put tons of cheese on top which is always a plus. because who doesn't love cheese?

you will not be disappointed!

First time at Biagglo's Pizzeria, picked up two large pizza - Veggie for lunch

Great Pizza experience, firstly the size - its massive like NY Pizza with a lot more higher quality dough and toppings. More gourmet kind of pizza. 
'It s bit on expensive side, but when I tasted the quality its well priced. 

One Pizza is good for three super hungry people, or maybe two and half. - we could not finish the first one, the second one is dinner 

If you are around this area, you must try their pizza, its a treat and the service is very courteous  and polite. Heaps better then those national franchise chains

I'm so glad we finally decided to try Biaggio's.  The reviews don't lie, great pizza.  I repeat, great pizza.  And the owner is totally friendly, hands on and obviously wants to ensure his continued success. Will be back for sure!

Molto bene!! 

The Stromboli here will knock your socks off. All you need to know. If you want to enjoy some takeout, a step above pizza, bring home the classier cousin - Stromboli! 

I can't explain what makes it so much more delightful than pizza or a calzone but it just is. I have enjoyed the meat lovers 3 times now and impressed others by serving it. One is around $18 and serves 3 - 4 people. Can't beat that! 

Biaggios is a cute hole in the wall with around 10 tables. You could dine in if you wanted. The owner is ultra friendly and I've always had excellent service.  

Do yourself a favor and try something way better than other pizza takeout.

So, I found the customer service to be TOP NOTCH and the pies to be the TOTAL OPPOSITE!

My order consisted of 5 pies, two house/garden salads and wings. The salad was the biggest hit and the wings were decent. The pizza was... Utterly forgettable, and pizza is my FAVORITE FOOD - from gestation to this very day! There is literally too much competition in this arena for me to ever consider Biaggio's for PIZZA again!

I was stuck betwixt Niko's and Biaggio's, and though my gut was screaming "Niko's!" I chose Biaggio's due to the volume of reviews and resulting high average... Which is why I was compelled to write this review!

* Sauce lacked flavor, big time
* Cheese was seriously not great
* Crust/dough was a solid foundation darn good actually (This is where the greatness ended)

Thank you for your attention
The owner is wonderful and always courteous. He explains the menu and makes you understand the natural ingredients used in his recipes. Absolutely wonderful and delicious for the price.

Probably 3.5 stars.  I love pizza.  And I'm no pizza snob.  I can enjoy a good slice of Domino's.  Heck, I'll even wolf down a piece of Little Caesar's if times are tight.  But if I have my choice, it would be high end gourmet pizza (think, Grimadi's, Due Forni). 

Overall, I found Biaggio's to be a little greasy for my taste, but the sauce had a great flavor and it is definitely cheaper than the high end pizza places I like to frequent.  We had a pepperoni and mushroom pizza and I was a fan of the crust.  Not too thick, not too thin.  Got a salad too but was nothing to write home about.  My man seemed to enjoy the food, so if you aren't worried about grease, Biaggio's is a great choice!

My roommate bought a pepperoni pizza from this place and I didn't get to try it till the next day, but let me just tell you that it's soooooo gooood! It's more on the thin side type of pizza and it's kinda greasy but it's got that gooey cheese! The RANCH is AMAZING, and it's homemade!!!! I wish they sold their ranch in bottles!

Good calzone, good pizza and great service.

The only bad thing I have to say is their online ordering menu portal is not quite up to date with their available inventory (they no longer do the Chicken Bacon Ranch specialty pizza and the beverages are not all available in 2 liters) and it glitched on me for the first time today after 10 previous online orders.  When the order did not come in 1.5 hours, I called and Mr. Biaggio got right on the phone to apologize and make it up to me, which he did so in hospitable fashion.  It's rare that the owner of a business addressess the day to day issues so directly and the value of that touch is certainly not lost on me.  I have a feeling Mr. Biaggio will be contacting his website developer to knock out the only complaint I can think of...

Came to this restaurant on a Saturday around lunch time because my fiancé was getting a tattoo next door. The restaurant was very clean & friendly. I was greeted & helped as soon as I walked in the door. I ordered a slice of pizza & antipasto salad. The lady taking my order offered me their 2 slice of pizza special that came with a drink. My food was ready fast & it was delicious! Would recommend for a nice little lunch. Or even dinner!

So yummy and the people that work here are so nice.  Also very fast!  Or maybe just the time I came in.  I've only been here twice so I haven't had any bad experiences yet.  A small place with some seating outside.  The deli counter is just an example of what they have, but you can order and make any pizza you want even if it's just by the slice.  Their lunch special is two slices of pizza and a drink  for $6 and change.  I came here on a pizza mission, I live two minutes away I can't wait to get home!

This was one of the few places that had gluten free crust, and it ended up being the best gluten free crust I have ever had. The sauce was also very flavorful. The topping options were fantastic, and the service was great. If I ever come back to Las Vegas, I will definitely come back here!

Best pepperoni pizza I've had in Las Vegas. When you think about what you want in a good pie, trust me you'll find it here. The toppings were phenomenal from the cheese to the pepperonis, and don't get me started on the crust. The best pizza crust I've ever had hands down. I even asked the owner what makes a good pie and he told me it's about the oils he puts in the dough. The wings we had for starters were very flavorful and bold, very delicious. Overall Biaggios pizzeria is the place to be if you're looking for awesome pizza pie!
This is my go to spot anytime I need my italian fix! They make the best stromboli I have ever had.. reminds me of back home.
Biaggio's is fine Italian food at extremely reasonable prices for the quality. Don't be surprised if Biaggio comes to your table to welcome you into the family.

I had a few guests over last night and we decided to order out.  We picked Stromboli from Biaggio's.  There was 6 of us, one man, a couple of delicate flower eaters, and a few more enthusiatic ones.  I never want to commit the party foul of not enough food, so I ordered two meat lover's strombolis and 12 garlic knots.  It was a lot of food because we had also made a large salad to accompany our take-out.  Well, the stromboli was so juicy and deeeeeeeeeelicious, that even our little delicate flowers were taking thirds!!  Yikes!  We almost ran out.  I have had pizza from here before and it too was fabulous.  You can eat in.  The place is small but cute.  The proprietor is very friendly and accomodating.  You must give it a try!

I cannot for the life of me see how this place got 4.5 stars. I have lived all over the US and this is by far the worst pizza place I have ever eaten in. I might as well get a piece of cardboard out of the trash bin and put some ketchup on it. The sauce was bland, noticeable lack of seasoning in general, cheese was not melted enough and the whole pizza fell apart when a slice was picked up. I have yet to find a go to pizza joint in Vegas! Grimaldi's I could give 3.5 stars but not one place could I even give a 4 star rating. If you know of a good pizza joint please message me. I am a pizza fanatic but suffering here in Vegas!

OMG.!!! The strombli was absolutely amazing.  Beautiful golden crust done to perfection, meatball, mozzerella and ricotta filling was absolutey devine.  I thought when I took my first bite I would have pulled a Meg Ryan like in When Harry Met Sally, except for the fact the 2 metro officers eating there probablly would have cuffed me and carried me off the the psych ward.  GUY FIETI, if you think your buddies at 4 kegs make good stromboli, you obviously haven't tasted great stromboli.  We also ordered a pizza and it was wonderful.  Owner was very sweet and came over and asked how everything was.  Of course I couldn't stop complimenting him and thats when he told us the sauce which is the best, was his aunts recepie and the olive oil EVOO imported, and the tomatoes from Italy, packed within 6 hours of being picked.  I also noticed that Mr. Biaggio was like the inspector general with every order that came out of that kitcken.  He personally inspected the food and gave each plate his seal of approval.  Very impressed with the pride that went into making each dish and quality of ingredients.

Such authentic, home-made marinara sauce that you'll wanna kiss your Italian mamma even if you're not Italian!! 
Pizza crust is perfecto - no salt or sugar added. 
Beautiful presentation in the front glass...like art you can eat - arranged to make ya hungry! 
Like I said, "love on a plate"!

The best veggie pizza my wife and I have ever had in Vegas. And the spaghetti with marinara plus meatballs was absolutely delicious.  Would have liked to have rolls or garlic bread with the spaghetti,  couldn't remember if was on the menu.  Regardless, Great tasting food, that's all anyone needs to know about Biaggio's.  Our go to Italian whenever we are in this part of town.
Real pizza is all I can say!! Great customer service and any and all my questions were answered. Fair price for a good NY style pie!

A recent workplace discussion regarding favorite calzone places in Vegas culminated today in the Calzone Contest.  I brought the Meat Lover's calzone and also the East Coast (a ricotta and mozzarella with garlic) both from Biaggio's.  My friend brought a meat calzone from Grimaldi's and was certain that she would be victorious.

With six self-proclaimed aficionados acting as judges, everyone ate at least one piece from each calzone.  At the end of the day five of the six people determined that Biaggio's was the best calzone they had ever eaten.  Mostly discussed were compliments regarding the crust and the ricotta cheese used, as well as the pepperoni and sausage.  My friend (after quickly conceding defeat) has even decided that Biaggio's will now be her favorite spot and can't wait to try other items on the menu.

Biaggio's has amazing food and top-notch customer service.  That's why I eat there.  I'm thrilled that I was able to introduce four new customers to my favorite pizza place.  

Grazie!

We've been to Biaggio's twice this week already! Once on Monday and the second time on Thursday, but it's always been to go.  The fiancé ordered pizza and wings on Monday. THE WINGS ARE TO DIE FOR! I'm pretty much addicted to their wings and could eat them all the time. The wings are crunchy on the outside and moist on the inside dipped in ranch and hot sauce, its just irresistible. The pizza I thought was good, but nothing like out of this world. We just got the plain pepperoni on one half and mushrooms and sausage on the other half. 
Last night we decided to try a stromboli. It was actually bigger than I had thought it was going to be. We went with the Chicken with artichokes and red pepper. I loved the artichokes in it, but other than that I think I would stick with the 6.99 stromboli's vs our specialty stromboli which was 12.99. Both meals ended up around 30 bucks, which seems a lil pricey for some pie and wings. I definitely will be back for the wings though.

Hands down, this place is amazing! Service is great as well as the food. I'm in love with the chicken artichoke pizza. The flavors are amazing and the pizza seems so light. The crust is also something to be happy about. I'm generally not a fan of pizza crust, but Biaggio's has the bet texture. 
I must also add that speaking to Biaggio is always entertaining. He is one of the nicest people I have met and he's always happy to make delicious suggestions!

My husband and I wee getting our car fixed and this gem was in the same parking lot so we decided to dine here since we had to wait on our car anyways... let me tell you, the food and service was A-M-A-Z-I-N-G. This is definitely the go to spot for us now. Came here two days in a row just to order the chicken wings. 
The chicken wings are absolutely my favorite out of the pizza and garlic knots we ate. However, those were delicious, too! 
We ended up ordering their lunch special which consists of a drink and two pizza slices of your choice. 
We expected the slices to be small, so we each ordered our own special. The pizzas are freaking huge and we could've honestly shared, but at least I brought home leftovers ;P
I ordered a slice of the Art of Chicken, my husband ordered a slice of BBQ chicken, and our second slice we both ordered was White Pizza. 
I actually tried his BBQ chicken and it was tasty! The BBQ is sweet and I love sweet :P 
I ordered the Art of Chicken without olives and it was delicious. I think the roasted tomatoes is what topped it off in deliciousness! 
And I love how every slice of their pizza was crunchy. It's thin crusted pizza with crunch. Just the way I love it. 
Order the garlic knots, to try. If you love garlic, DO IT. Yummy and fluffy :P
Thank you for your service, it was delicious and at a great price of only $30!
2 lunch specials, garlic knots, and 6 wings.

Biaggio the owner of Biaggio's can make a dreary day seem sunny and marvelous.  If you're feeling like no one cares - this is your place!  What about the food?  Let me tell you !  The meatball sandwich is the best one I've had (and I've had many !) End your meal with the zeppole - delicate and velvety !  You won't be sorry.

I really wish I loved this place as much as everyone else does because it is ridiculously close to where I live. Unfortunately, it fell short of the hype.

I ordered delivery from Biaggio's and everything went fine, nice person over the phone, delivery was on time (you'd hope so since I could literally walk there). My gripe was with the pizza itself, along with the side orders I had.

I've had pizza in NYC, this is not NYC style. The crust is much thicker, the sauce was thick and the cheese made a hard layer over the top. You know that kind of cheese, that would all just come off in one piece? It was like that. The crust itself had small bumps on the bottom which means it was probably baked in a pizza tray, and not just tossed and slid into the oven. All of this is perfectly acceptable if this is your taste, but it's not for me.

I ordered a side salad with Italian dressing, and the salad came topped with olives, cheese, tomatoes and cucumber. The tomatoes were mealy and tasteless because they had been in the fridge for too long. The dressing wasn't as sharp as I'd like and I ended up adding some red wine vinegar at home.

I ordered the zucchini sticks specifically because it said "sticks." I hate zucchini rounds, because when they're cut like that, they get overcooked and loose their texture. It also means a lot more breading, and rounds are always breadcrumbs. I like zucchini sticks that are beer battered, and was hoping these would be like that, but knew not to expect the beer batter. I was disappointed, since I was expecting sticks at least.

All of these things I think mostly come down to a preference, but I didn't see the same quality everyone else did. I might end up giving this place another try, but with Those Guys also in the vicinity, it'll be tough for me to break away after my first experience.

Decent pizza spot in Summerlin. Their pie was good, better than most in Vegas. The staff is friendly and the establishment has always been clean. The only item I was dissapointed in was the Meatball hero (or sub). It was SUPER small. I don't remember exactly how much it was, but I would have paid a little more to have a bigger portion. The owner brags about how his place is similar to an NY joint...the pizza, maybe. But the Meatball hero needs some work. I will definately be back for some pizza.

P.S- VERY strange that a pizza place is closed on Sundays. I worked in about 3 different pizza places, and each one of them Sunday football was the second busiest day of the week. Maybe they should re-consider?

Actually it's a 3.5. Good quality, authentic to the East coast, crust crispy. Losses .5 because of cost. A small pizza (no matter what they call it) with 1.5 toppings to go north of $18. just isn't worth it.

Ordered a pickup pizza and was STOKED to come on and see the Lakers game on as it is! Was welcomed with a hello from the owner, Biaggio himself, and felt the friendly greeting immediately. Upon leaving after a brief conversation at the register he told me and my buddy to take a couple bars of ice cream as a complement to our pizzas. 

Everything is QUALITY. From the ingredients down to the customer service (not to mention the team selection to play on TV ), biaggios can't go wrong in any aspect! 

ps. I've had all the best pizza spots in town from Rocco's, to Secret Pizza, to Detroit pizza and *confidently* I say Biaggio's tops em all. 2 thumbs up.

So I've been seeing plenty of check-ins and reviews from my fellow Yelpers (via Yelp App :) of this restaurant that I did not realize was just minutes away from my house. So one night we wanted to try something new and from the sounds of the reviews, this place was a "Must Try" and I have got to say, Yelpers could have never been so damn right! 

Our Order: 
1 SALAD, Dressings; Blue Cheese, Ranch, Italian. So I am not much of a Blue cheese fan but 

1 SUPREME PIZZA. Ok so I'm a NY Style Pizza kinda gal as my husband is a Deep Dish kinda guy, hails from Chicago, but you would have never known that the night we came in! The sauce, as Biaggio says "Is to die for!" and it seriously is! 

1 EGGPLANT PARMESAN 

1 CANOLI. Never in Vegas have I found a place that does the Canoli RIGHT, til December 11, 2010. Creamy, yummy, make your eyes roll to the back your head--goodness! 

I have been in Vegas close to 6 years now and I have not been able to find a quality pizza joint that I can speak so highly about. You can feel the love that Biaggio puts into his restaurant and food. You can taste the freshness, quality but above all, they really do know how to take care of you. You don't feel like a customer, ya start to feel that homely, family feeling that you rarely see these days. 

Will we be back? DUH.

Wonderful gluten free pizza! Very crispy and wonderful ingredients. I got the "Art of Chicken" (with light garlic recommended). 

Service was Kind and caring. 

Partner got regular supreme and wings and also loved it. A tiny bit greasy but I'd only go to 4.5 stars. 

We loved supporting this small business!

Biaggio is a boss. Food was excellent. Father was visiting from overseas, and he kept mentioning how great the pizza was during the meal, so much so that he claims this is the best pizza he's EVER had!

Biaggio even extended the courtesy of upgrading the pizza from a small to a medium. Eat here. You won't be disappointed. 

Thank you, Biaggio. Will be back when in LV!!

Slowly turning into my favorite pizza place. It's a little small and casual, but I'd rather have it cozy than big and restaurant-chain style. Try as much as you can, I did the knots, wings, and pizza with a friend and we finished everything. I only wish they were open on Sundays.
Five star food, everything was excellent and the customer service was over the top.  With 15 min notice they handled our baseball team with a great buffet.  Overall great!

Finally! I'm home! I moved here from New York City and it took me two years to find a great pizza restaurant. I ordered two cheese slices to test it out and I had to order two more since it was made exactly how it should be. No other pizza place comes close, and I've been to them all in Vegas. Great job by everyone here.

1st time visiting and immediately greeted.  Place is nice , very clean, and welcoming.  Ordered a large pepperoni sausage mushroom pizza and can say hands down, the best pizza in the neighborhood.  Ingredients taste fresh and prices are reasonable.  I will definitely be enjoying this pizza again very soon

The food was phenomenal! I had the Meatball Sub lunch special and had the best conversation with the handsome, young man behind the counter. (His head is shaved by choice) I will definitely be back to try the rest of their menu!

Great tasting pizza!!! I'm from Chicago and tried another place and wasn't pleased. I found this place here on yelp and had to try it. I loved it!! Prompt service and aweseme pizza! I will definitely be back for more!!!

Service is excellent & very friendly. Establishment was clean.

Value is good... $5.99 for 2 large slices and a drink.

Pizza is average. We ordered the pineapple & ham slices, which were ok. I ordered the "Art of Chicken" which consisted of diced white meat chicken, artichokes, peppers, garlic and black olives. The picture shown in the restaurant was nothing close to what I got. The toppings were piled on after, on a sauceless cheese slice. I guess this is how they customize each plain slice. What bothered me the most was the smell of dirty dish rag that kept wafting from the pizza or was it the parmesan cheese shaker? It was hard to say. I didn't enjoy it at all, but luckily I did get a backup slice of cheese as my 2nd pick. The cheese slice was good, but swimming in a pool of grease. Be careful not to splash it on your clothing like I happened to do.
I wish I enjoyed it more as the people in there were very nice and kept asking, "was it delicious?". I didn't have the heart to say "no...", so I just nodded.
There is a certain smell of garlicky sauce, a hot pizza oven, etc. when you first walk into a really good pizza place that unfortunately Biaggio's lacked.

The guy who helped me and my brother today was great, very energetic and outgoing. We didn't know what we wanted to eat so he helped us decide as well. The food didn't take to long to make and was fresh. Definitely will be coming back.
Best place for gluten free food.  Everything is good here.  I've had it all.  Fresh bread is hard to find and this place has it.

Gluten free Italian food is hard to find but there's numerous options here! Tried the gluten free ravioli and manicotti and both were excellent. Veggie pasta was also super fresh and tasty as an appetizer for 2. Will be coming back!

My first time eating their food and everything was great. Since it was my first time I was offered 20% off my order. I ordered their white pizza with sausage and pepperoni and their wings. Everything tasted very good. Only thing I have to complain about is that for $1 a wing, the wings were rather small in my opinion. That's definitely not a deal breaker. They've secured my business.

I've been wanting to try Biaggio's Deep Dish Pizza for a long time! It takes like an hour or two to prepare so my husband and I definitely planned ahead for this. It was so worth it! The crust was thick and crispy on the bottom. The ingredients onion, sausage, pepperoni, and green peppers were fresh. Yum! 

I couldn't come here without ordering the chicken wings. I'm addicted to that crunch ! I ate them all in one sitting...they are a meal within in itself. 

The service is outstanding as usual! When you dine here they make you feel like family!

I went here specifically to try their breakfast pizza. I had contacted them ahead of time to let them know since I was going with a small group. So, when we got there it seemed odd that they weren't ready for us. Tables were dirty from the night before, tables and chairs for outdoor seating were stacked inside, etc. Odd, but no big deal.

We ordered garlic knots, drinks, and 2 breakfast pizzas (one veggie & one meat lovers). We were disappointed that "breakfast" doesn't include coffee, but whatever.

The breakfast pizzas were pretty delicious. The crust was thick and crispy with great flavor. The one with meat had generous amounts of ham, bacon, sausage, egg...it was fantastic. The veggie one had peppers, onions, spinach, tomato. Basically an amazing omelette pizza mash up.

The breakfast pizzas are only available on Fri & Sat 10-11a. You should definitely make an effort to check them out!!
Awesome pizza ! Phillycheese was also yummy ! Not only is food good but the owner and everyone there was super friendly ! Will definitely be returning !

Amazing. This is hands down THE best pizza I've had since I've moved to Vegas (wings too!) This was delivered to the office over the weekend, along with Caesar salad and garlic knots and the staff couldn't get enough. You know a restaurant is good when you want to rave about every item you had not just one thing in particular. 

Surprisingly, living in the area I've never even heard of the place but now I'm addicted, I'll be back with my husband this week. 


(So much for losing that post-baby weight, it's worth it!)

My first and last time. I couldn't even pick up a slice. It broke apart because it was so soggy. I used to make pizzas for Caesars, so I could tell that the dough was frozen then popped in the over. Crispy on outside and soggy on inside? Any cook can tell you that indicates frozen food. And the mushrooms were chewy. Fresh mushrooms are NOT chewy! I know that their veggies are not fresh and from a can. Nothing about this place is fresh at all and I will never come again

You guys rock! Once again our pizza, salad and zeppole were great! We order all the time. Some times it's delivery and some we pick up but the food is always great! Love that we can order through Yelp and it saves our orders since we don't really change much we can just re-order. The only thing we don't like is when we have to wait an hour for our pizza...but tonight it was here in less than 45 minutes so we will take it! The delivery guy was very cool and had great manners and engagement with us. We don't order in food very often (in fact hardly ever) but when we do this is the first place we think of. Even if we are at a friends house this is where we order from.  Thanks guys!

It's pretty good pizza, but it's definitely overpriced, and not good enough to justify a drive longer than 10 minutes. It was a thin crust, and they managed to make it come out not to greasy, and they are fairly generous with the toppings. The crust was just ok. Overall, I liked my pizza, but i was expecting more from a 4.5 Yelp star restaurant.

I had a gift certificate so I decided to try this place. SO HAPPY I DID! 
WOW!! AMAZING!! 
Their specialty pizza with chicken, artichoke hearts, tomatos, and black olives is EXCELLENT! Their garlic knots are beyond yummy and their salads are HUGE and super fresh!
The girl who answered the phone was so sweet and very knowledgeable about the menu items. Delivery was within the time they said and the delivery guy was nice. I gave him and extra great tip for the super service!
This is now my go-to pizza place!!

I was craving some good homemade Italian food minus me being the one to make it homemade so I opted for take out. I was able to easily order through Yelp and pick up my order within 20 mins.

My boyfriend and I shared the chicken Parmesan with spaghetti and some breaded mushrooms. This was easily enough for the two of us to share and the total was only around $20. I loved the sauce they used and the food was all cooked perfectly. I'd definitely return again.

We ordered delivery tonight of two large pizzas and a large Stromboli.  The driver accidentally gave us the wrong order and one of the pizzas wasn't what we ordered.  My wife called and explained what happened.  Biaggio apologized and told us to please eat the wrong pizza, and the correct pizza was on it's way.  Everything tasted great, and the correct pizza arrived in about 30 minutes.  On top of correcting the mistake, Biaggio also included a $30 gift certificate.  That is the epitome of customer service.  Biaggio has always been a class act at all of his establishments and we will gladly continue to order from him!

Visiting from San Diego for a hockey tournament and we decided to try this place for a team lunch. They were able to accommodate us with very short notice. The food was delicious and very affordable. The man with the shaved head was was great with our rowdy kids and didn't let the spilled drinks phase him. I would definitely go here again. Make it a point to try the garlic knots.
I recently moved back to this side of town and the quality is just as good as it was 5 years ago.  The owner takes customer service seriously and they have the best calzones in town!

Tried this place based on Yelp reviews. Thank you fellow yelpers for leading us here. We went on Sunday, and it was very quiet when we walked in. The gentleman who greeted us was so nice. The place was clean and the pizza was wonderful. Even though he seemed to be doing everything from taking orders, cooking, and serving...he was fast and efficient. I dont mind waiting on or paying for quality. The crust on the pizza was crispy perfection. Seriously, pizza crust seems to be a difficult task to perfect, but it was spot on. In the famous words of Arnold...I'll be back.

Excellent pizza place! We stopped in with some hungry hockey players & the owner set us up! Delicious pizza, pasta & excellent, family-friendly service! You can bring in wine/beer from outside as they don't serve alcohol but totally fine with us doing that. Definitely recommend!

I accidentally happened upon this pizzeria while stopping for the Snow Ono shaved ice truck in the parking lot. What an amazing find. I can't begin to describe how fresh all the ingredients were!! We had a Italian Stromboli, the pepperoni had just the right spicy bite w/o the heartburn, onions were sweet to contrast the strong mozzarella that had the perfect cheesy taste, salami was deli fresh, crust was perfectly crunchy, neither soggy or burnt. Simply amazing!!! Please try!!
First I've got to point out the great service. We ate in the restaurant. All the ingredients in the pizza tastes very fresh. Sauce cheese ratio was on point.
The pizza sauce was delicious. Fresh ingredients. Garlic knots and chicken wings are awesome.

I really wish I could get my money back. I'm an Italian from NJ and I'm not too much of a pizza snob, but I know good pizza. When I pay more than $26 for a 6-piece margherita pizza pie (delivered), I expect it to be at least pretty good. With the reviews this place got, I was incredibly disappointed and really regret my purchase. The mozzerella taste was decent, the sauce was fresh and homemade tasting, but completely lacked salt and garlic. There was so much sauce and so little mozzerella (and tomatoes) that the sauce overpowered the mozzerella and gave the pizza a bland smushed tomato taste. There were like 10 pieces of basil on the whole pizza and they were also completely flavorless (probably not fresh because I grow basil and would use it on homemade margherita pizzas and can always always taste it). The crust of the pizza was tough and did not taste good at all. The pizza was delivered rather quickly but the pizza was cold when I got it. I had to heat up a couple slices for 45 seconds. I definitely do not recommend this place - save your money. Huge regret.

Owner is a real nice friendly guy.  Pizza was fresh and crust was crunchy 
This place is a gem

Phenomenal family owned business with quality food and excellent service. 

I highly recommend trying the Meat Lover's Pizza. It has meatballs, pepperoni, salami, and mushrooms. Very yummy and great textures.

One of the best pizzas I've had in a very long time. 
When I first arrived I was a little skeptical. It's in a strip mall with just a few tables. Boy was I wrong!
You have to try the garlic knots - big juicy knots of love with home made marinara.
The pizza was the highlight though. Perfect crust, the homemade sauce was perfect as well. You can taste the differences between their quality ingredients and other pizzas. 
There's other thing that made the meal great was the owner. He was so friendly and talkative that outer felt like I knew him for a long time - Ives never been there before! 
I'll be back next time I visit Vegas.

Best deal in town - 2 New York style slices any toppings (supreme, meat lover, chicken artichoke) and a drink at a cheap price - great value.  You can get one meat lovers and another one supreme etc... Slices cooked perfectly, no drooping when you pick up, most other New York styles I have tried droop.

Biaggio joins Bo from Yi Mei Champion Deli on the list of the absolute nicest owners you could ever meet. People like Biaggio are the precise reason why we need to support our local businesses. Great food. Personal service. Owners who aren't happy until you're happy.

It was New Year's Day and my friend and I were looking for a place to watch the Rose Bowl. I called Biaggio's to make sure they'd be open and he said they'd switch the channel to whatever we wanted to watch.

When we got there, Biaggio somehow recognized me from Yelp. He knew I was the one who ended up backing out of the CMYE. Wow! For someone who claims to not be all that internet-savvy, he sure does keep a finger on the pulse of social media.

Long story short, my friend ordered an Italian Stromboli and I had a Pastrami Stromboli. We didn't realize how huge they would be, so we added some Garlic Knots for good measure. The Garlic Knots were extremely moist and doughy on the inside. And they're huge! But nowhere near as huge as the Strombolis. Even with a 3-hour game, there was no way we'd be able to eat all that food. Oh and yes, the Strombolis were all they were hyped up to be. I personally like the Pastrami over the Italian and my friend concurs. So delicious.

With our Strombolis only half eaten, the food coma was setting in and we decided to leave at half time. Biaggio stops us and says we have some Fried Dough on the way. Um. OK. How can you turn down free food from such a generous man? Of course, the Fried Dough was awesome. It's basically pizza dough topped with butter, cinnamon, and powdered sugar. It smelled really sweet, but it was surprisingly mellow. We had a few pieces and added the rest to our to-go boxes.

It goes without saying that I'll be coming back. I need to try the Chicken Wings that everyone is raving about. Also, when I mentioned that my boss loves pastrami, he offered to send us a Pastrami Stromboli when I return to work on Monday. Now that is the epitome of generosity! (I'll be sure to supplement that with my own order of Chicken Wings).

5 stars

I love this little joint. The restaurant is small but it truly makes one of my favorite pizzas in town. They have a pretty diverse menu with unique pizzas. Their price point is also very reasonable and affordable. One of my favorite pizzas are the white pizzas, in particular the art of chicken. The service is also good they try to make you feel as comfortable as possible. So if you are looking for a laid back and tasty pizza this is the place to go!

Ordered pizza for delivery.  Although expensive, it is very good and fresh.  Does not taste like card board!!  The crust was perfect, sweet, soft and crisp all at the same time.  The sauce was wonderful and plenty of cheese!

Just ordered pizza and baked ziti. The pizza was average, very greasy. The baked ziti was delivered cold and seemed to be flavorless, the pizza was luke warm at best. The delivery arrived quickly after ordering, so I have to assume the ziti was packed up cold and sent out that way. It would seem the food was not made to order but rather was sitting around under a heat lamp hoping to be ordered. Definitely will not eat here again, there are better pizza options out there for the price.

Ordered from Biaggio's because they offer gluten free pizza and one person in our group has Celiac's.  Here's how the night went...

"Hey, what should we order for dinner?" 
"Let's try Biaggio's, I know they have gluten free pizza."
"Cool, we'll get one gluten free and one for the regular folk...who can eat real food."

We called and ordered one gluten free pizza and one large with half "Art of Chicken" and half "White Pizza."  They said it would be about 50-55 minutes.

An hour and ten minutes later, I called to check on the pizza...
"Hey, yeah, so it's been over an hour, just checking to see what the deal is..."
Pizza guy: "Oh...let me check...ok, 10-15 minutes."
Me: "10-15 minutes for it to BE here or for it LEAVE there?"
Him: "10-15 minutes."
Me: "Ok..."

...another 30 minutes goes by, we call back again and they're allegedly "on the way."  

Pizza finally arrived and as it turns out, they gave us the whole order for free.  Unfortunately, the food was pretty mediocre overall.  I'm giving them two stars for comping the meal.
Great local owned pizza place. Staff messed up the order and gave us an extra pizza. Definitely coming again and again. Can't go wrong and great gluten free options as well. A+ all around.
The Supreme pizza is delicious!!! This place is a hidden gem! Can't wait to come back and try their other specialty pizzas.

Biaggio's is delicious!! This our 2nd visit and we love it! We ordered the supreme Stromboli and a large pepperoni and sausage pizza. My kids ate it all up and loved it! Mr. Biaggio takes such great care of his customers, he is so friendly and always goes above and beyond. He gave all 4 of my kids ice cream and one of my boys wanted meat lovers pizza so he made 2 of the slices on the pizza meat lovers just for him! We will be back over and over again!!

I have decided to give this place another try since my bf liked it the first time and this place is close to where we live. Needless to say we are both disappointed so it's not just me anymore. We have both crossed this off our list of go to pizza place. First of all, they fucked up our order which was supposed to be half white pizza and half sausage with marinara sauce. Instead we ended up with white pizza all over and half with sausage. Wtf? My bf is so nice that he didn't want the hassle to go back and complain. Apparently he didn't check the order when he picked it up. But now they also burned the crust like 50 percent of the crust is burned. So gross! We are never going back to this place again. You had your chance Biaggio!

Delicious, delicious, delicious!!! Best pizza and wings I've had in a very long time. Glad I discovered this spot, will be ordering many, many more times from here. Marinara sauce with their garlic rolls are very tasty.

Oh my....Amo questo luogo! We had a  pepperoni pizza and another with spinach,  feta, & sliced tomatoes.  Both were great.  The sauce, the cheese, the crust....delicious! Also, we've tried the Italian calzone. Huge and heavy! So good.

Was craving good pizza, decided to try this place based on yelps 4 1/2 star review.   

Ordered take out,  small mushroom, garlic, onion,  sausage and 4 wings just to try it out.   

Pizza: literally could count each of the toppings on the pizza. Cheap with their toppings!!!  Pizza was ok, not 4 star in my book.  Was not the kind of pizza where you eat the 1st slice and it kept you wanting more.  Tasted a bit doughy, maybe cause there wasn't enough sauce, or toppings.  

Wings: was good but wasn't "the bomb" like the person that took my order made it out to be.  Ranch was additional charge.   Did not come with it.

Would I go back...no.  This place is nothing out of the ordinary,  not worth the trip.  Much rather go to Custom Built Pizza where the toppings actually cover the pizza.  They are both ok pizza, but if I had to choose between the two.   Custom Built would be my choice due to the fact that of the generous toppings.  Grimaldi's still have the best tasting pizza.  Just don't like that its so thin.
Seriously THE BEST pizza!!!  Two big slices and large drink $6.99!!!  My whole family loves this place.  Ft. Apache and Flamingo, by Home Depot.

The pepperoni had good flavor. It didn't fulfill my pizza fix though. I got pizza from another place the very next day. The pizza was thin with a thicker crust, light on the sauce and cheese. Nothing to rave about in my opinion.

Being from NY I find it hard to get great pizza out here. There's nothing in Las Vegas that comes close to the excellent service and food that Biaggios provides! The owner is friendly and even gave me 20% off 2 large pies for being a repeat customer! Thank you for a taste of home!

The owner is incredibly NICE! Awesome service! It's a mom/pop type pizza joint with great food. They do deliver anywhere in vegas. I HIGHLY recommend the garlic butter knots. 

This place is by far my favorite pizza place in vegas and one of my favorite restaurants. If the drive wasn't so far from me in NW vega I probably would eat here quite often.

The meatball parmesan sub is the BEST!   We had read several reviews and had to try for ourselves and were not disappointed.  Fresh bread, good sauce, oozy cheese and delicious meatball - I can still taste it.  We split a sandwich for lunch, along with an order or wings and didn't eat the balance of the day.

Only change I would make is remove the TVs.   Why do all restaurants feel they have to entertain us with TV when we're dining?  We enjoy the experience of being together and enjoying a meal, but TV noise is quite annoying.

Come here and you are immediately family.  Biaggio is the man - kind, genuine, all loving. 

And how about that food - supreme pizza, meat lovers, fried mozzarella sticks, fried mushrooms and veggie salad.  The pizza crust is so perfect, reminded me of being a child and having pizza for the first time.  

Just go here and feel like family.

Always good food! Never been disappointed with any of the items we've tried! Caesar salad is best I've ever tasted, garlic knots soft and buttery, pizza just the right thickness crust... I could keep going, but really, you gotta try it out for yourself! One of our almost weekly eateries!!

Excellent food and an owner who is a true gentleman who understands the value of being involved in and takes pride in offering only the best...From quality of food to service...A rare jewel in a sea of mediocrity. Keep up the good work !

Got this pizza last week. The most delicious pizza I've ever had. Huge and thick crust with lots of sauce- the way I love it. I also got a veggie calzone which was equally as delicious. Most definitely will be back.

Yelped for Pizza places....and came across this establishment.....there Pizza is amazing so is there hot wings and there salads are amazing.....had a ceasers salad it was amazing. ....the owner and everyone that worked there was very polite and Friendly. ....definitely worth going to. .....when in Vegas I will be coming back.......
Great pizza place! Owner is super nice and friendly.  Come support the small business guy!

PHENOMENAL! I would give it as may stars as possible. The service was awesome as was the food, it's not just some little pizza joint, it's simply the best pizza joint in the valley. The owner and his staff should train other restaurants on how to take of their customer's. If your a local and haven't eaten at BIAGGIOS, it should be your next stop! Again I will just say the whole experience was  PHENOMENAL!

This place is next to my esthetician and I asked her if this is a good pizza place and she said "it's a good everything place". 

I came in and ordered the chicken Parmesan sub and at first was shocked no side order came with it however, this is the best chicken Parmesan sub I've had in the 7 years I've lived in Vegas. Tasteful, juicy, and so filling! I'll definitely be back !

Found Biaggio's by accident. It was one time an accident had a happy ending.  The pizza was exceprional, the business was very clean and friendly, and service was awesome. Thank you Biaggio for sharing your time with us.
Yum! The lunch special of two huge pizza slices was delicious - and at a great price! Friendly and prompt service. I will be back!
Las pizzas son excelentes, el servicio es muy amable pero si hay algo que tiene este lugar que lo diferencía de todos los demás es el postre Zeppole (vas a llorar del gusto).
The crust always makes or breaks a pizza, and this was great! The slices were huge and very reasonably priced! I defiantly recommend this place to anyone looking a few slices for lunch!

Finally checked out Biaggio's Pizzeria when Sno Ono had their last day event.  They were so awesome in partnering with them and giving out free slices as a result!  

What makes them really special is that the Little Guy normally does not eat pizza.  Trust me, we've been trying and pushing and he usually just eats the olives off the pizza.  But for some reason, he saw us eating their cheesy slice and wanted some.  We obliged and he asked for more!  Unheard of!

What's even more amusing is that the Husband had pizza twice earlier that week and was pizza-ed out!  He rolled his eyes when he heard free pizza.  But then again, he had a slice of their pepperoni and went back for a few more!  I take that as a pretty good sign he was loving their version.

The staff are great - friendly and were constantly cleaning!  They wiped down the tables and swept after each guest!  When do you ever see that happen at any restaurant these days?

Biaggio's is awesome!  I found this place on Yelp and ordered delivery on a Friday night.  Pizza came hot and on time.  We ordered the Mozzarella sticks which are pretty pedestrian, however the Garlic Knots are heavenly!  This is great NY style pizza that in no way resembles the cardboard and grease that you see in the mall!  The staff is super friendly and you will most likely meet Biaggio if you eat in or pick up.  Definitely try it!

Tried based on yelp reviews only and let's just say I'm so, so, so glad decided to try.

Upon understanding I had a long drive after pick up, the person at the counter offered me a free soft drink.  Wow, if that's not a friendly awesome service, I don't know what is.

Large pizza with half mushrooms & sausages and half with ham & pineapples.  To my surprise, my picky other half loved it, as did I.

For those of you living close by this place, I envy you.  I'd DEFINITELY would make the long trip to eat/carry out again!

Came here last minute for dinner on Thursday.

The place was empty except for another customer. Which I personally enjoyed because it meant a peaceful environment. 

The girl serving was extremely friendly, helpful, and sweet. She helped make the experience that much better. She showed energy and it made me feel happy to eat there.

The garlic knots were amazing! They were soft, buttery, and fluffy. People definitely need to try it if they at Biaggio's Pizzeria!!
We ordered the White Pizza and added chicken. The medium size was more than enough for two people. The pizza was delicious and I will be back for more in the future~

I definitely recommend people check this pizzeria out! (^0^)

The service was excellent. We chatted for awhile and while I didn't get his name I believe he was probably the owner/ manager?
Pepperoni Pizza: Very good. Thin crust just as I like it. The largest pizza was 10 slices and worked out perfect for 4 of us.

Ceasar Salad: Very good. We asked and were told it would probably serve 4 of us but we ended up needing to order another one and finished that off too.
 
Zeppoli: Amazing - these were delicious. Hot, airy little fried pillows of dough with a delicious Raspberry Sauce to dip them in. 

Next time I'm in Las Vegas and craving pizza I'll be back.

We have been looking for a  pizza place. Been to several but didn't really cut it. We found this place. Didn't really expect much and boy we were surprised! The food was awesome!!! We had wings and the meat pizza with mushroom and onions. The wings were perfect, crispy on the outside, juicy inside! Sauce was good too. The pizza was the best I've had. We met the owner. Very nice man, great service!!! Oh he makes the metballs and sausage!!! You can taste the flavors of each ingredient, perfectly complemented each other! Gonna be back soon!
Awesome pizza. And the Ceasar salad great!  Te service was excellent! So happy we stopped here for this wonderful pizza.
I love this pizza place! Never disappointed with the food or the service!!! My favorite is the meat lovers pizza. The chicken fingers are also pretty tasty!
Ordered carryout online excellent service, in and out, and the calzones and strombolis are totally delish
Very delicious pizza. Fast delivery too. I highly recommend this to the rest of community.
Best pizza I found thus far. If you from the East Coast, you will love this pizza. Sauce reminds me  Brooklyn!

Oh my goodness. I ordered a Philly Cheesesteak my brother in law ordered a calzone and we got an order of garlic knots we had it delivered and when it came the lady was very nice and the food was hot. And it's HUGE!!! So good worth it. Will definitely come back!!!

I don't even think this place deserves two stars... But to be fair to the other places I've rated with one star, this is slightly better. Maybe. Eh. Not really. 

So I paid $57 and change for a large pizza with three toppings on half the pizza only (they charge $1 for each topping, even veggies, even if it's only on one half of the pizza. Fantastic...), fries, and some chicken fingers. So the choice of chicken fingers is $8 for three. Three. Or $21 for 10. Got 10 because I couldn't see paying $8 for only three. 

Pizza came. The entire bottom of it was wet. Not because of the sauce. Wet like from water or condensation. Nasty. Pizza wasn't great. I was told it was "the best" and as a New Yorker, I'd be impressed. I'm impressed at how bad it was. The sauce was eh. The cheese wasn't good quality... The pizza didn't have a great taste. And it was completely soggy from the wetness. The leftovers weren't even good enough to save and reheat later. I threw it out. I never do that. 

Chicken fingers. Thought maybe they'd be good ones--worth $8 for 3. Nope. Regular frozen fingers you can get ANYWHERE. In fact, I can name five places off the top of my head that serve the exact same ones. And none of them cost $8 for THREE fingers. And when you buy fingers, they don't give you ranch. You have to pay $1 extra for each. I told them they can kindly screw themselves. Was about to cancel my order and she said she'd "take care of those" for me. Oh how sweet of you. 

The fries were mediocre. Nothing special to write home about. Wasn't worth almost $60 in total. And for the amount I paid for fries, I would have thought we'd get more of them. 

Won't go back there. Ever. (This was a delivery order, but still... Either way.)

Wish I could get my money back. But you live and learn.

The pizza was good and I see why others like it. I myself did no tlike the flavor. The cheese they used seem to have almost a smokey flavor ? I can't quite put my finger on it but I won't be ordering from here again even though I'm sure others love it. Best of luck

I'm house sitting my best friend's house, and I was craving some pizza. After doing some research, I came across this gem. I've enjoyed some delish pizza in New York, and some crazy awesome cheesy pizza in Chicago (hello Giordano's), but NOTHING compares to the pizza I had tonight at Biaggio's. I ordered half and half of the Art of Chicken (artichokes, roasted tomatoes, olives and garlic) and the other half was the GEM: White Pizza which is mozzarella & ricotta cheese, olive oil, and garlic. Sure it sounds plain like you need a protein, but no. This is hands down the best BEST best pizza I have ever had. Although I enjoyed the Art of Chicken, I was kicking myself for not ordering a whole White Pizza. I'm a crust snob, and this crust was buttery and delicious. I seriously highly recommend!!
This place is great, a nice little intimate setting and a little bit of outdoor seating. Also they have a wide range of pizza toppings. The food is pretty good as well.

This place is incredible!
I walked in to order a large pepperoni pizza with sausage and they told me it will be about 20 minutes(which is relatively quick for the quality of the zzas)
As I waited I noticed they had wifi but I neglected to ask for the password.
I forgot to mention that the employees were so friendly and kind to everyone in the restaurant.
The pizza came on time and I took the pizza home and the pizza was delicious!
The sausage had a lot of spices and tasted very exquisite, the crust was toasty and soft at the same time.
Overall delicious and amazing employees will buy again.

I'll admit that I'm a bit hard on pizzerias. This town is severely lacking and when one stands up above average I will acknowledge it. This place is above the average Las Vegas pizzeria. The pie had a good flavor, the sauce is definitely better than most. The crust is very good as well. I've now ordered three times from this location. It has a lot of potential. There are things I really liked and things I'm not crazy about.

First and most obvious problem is that they are closed on Sunday. Are you f*&cking kidding me?? It's a pizzeria, closed on a Sunday. That's blasphemy. Football, pizza, wings, and beer. That's the way it is meant to be. Ok so with that initial disappointment aside let's move on.

If you want legit reviews, ignore the 5 star ones. They are bought and paid for because the owner will do whatever to get 5 star reviews. I'm not saying he actually gives money for em, but he will give away food and gift cards like it's water if he knows you're a Yelper. That doesn't really sit well with me. I thought I was alone till I read the other real reviews here. The pizza was good one out of the thee times I ordered (only after my bad review), and definitely in no way is a 5 star product. Don't be whores Yelpers!! 

The first time I ordered everything was pretty good. The pie was a little undercooked for my taste but everything was ok. The second time was just awful. My pizza was very undercooked and the cheese was running everywhere, the calzone was also undercooked as in nearly raw.

So the third time I ordered everything was near perfect. I ordered a Sicilian and Garlic Knots. The Garlic Knots were similar to New York. It brought me back home the whole time I was devouring them. The Sicilian was definitely one of the best I've had in town. It was tasty and thick (refrain from the That's what she said for a moment.) It was also soft and had the perfect chewiness to it.
