It's a rectangle cut into 8 squares. In New York you usually get a square pizza that takes up an entire 16" box but here it is common to find them in this 8 slice rectangle. Which is fine, but I absolutely love the giant square style because you get those awesome center pieces which has no crust and is just cheesy goodness on every side. Just be prepared that you will probably have a longer wait if you order a Sicilian. The first time I tried to order I was told the wait was at least two hours (WTF?) and I was starving, so I ordered a regular pie. The next time I prepared myself and ordered early, it was delivered in an hour and a half which was very bearable considering I was expecting two hours.

Now they are pricey, but if the food is as good as the last time I ordered it, then it isn't too bad. After a few bumps along the way I could see this place having potential. They just need to work on their consistency. It's holding me back from being a regular here.
Stopped in for a quick lunch and the service was great, great lunch specials.  Pizza was fresh and made just the way you wanted it.  The house made sausage is great, perfect topping to any pizza.

Second time ordering biaggios. Second review. First review got 4 stars. This pizza joint is kind of amazing. The wings are perfect! Crispy on the outside and tasty and the ranch is yummy too! THE ZEPOLES are ridiculous. Seriously biaggio, why you do me like that? They taste like the best sugary goodness jelly filled frosted covered donuts ever. Even the zepole w/o dipping sauce is really good. And the pizza is just good. We got half meat lover half chicken artichoke. Extra cheese please. Really good. Still think my fave is the supreme tho. Excellent service by the way. Best pizza on this side of twn.
They put way too much oregano in their sauce tried more than one item it was so overpowering it had no balance of flavors. All you can do is taste oregano. Owner was very very nice, sorry buddy.

2nd Review

My boss was craving for some pizza and so I suggested she ate some Biaggio's Pizzeria.  Without hesitation, she gave me her card and ordered the $5.95 two slices of pizza and a drink.  Since I was flying, she said she was buying.  I couldn't wait to try out the pizza's since the last time I wasn't feeling well so I couldn't enjoy the food as much as I wanted to.  My boss also was craving for some garlic bread and ordered that as well.

Mr. Biaggio was really nice and remembered me from the last time I visited.  It's really impressive how he remembers his customers.  It's rare to find an establishment like this.  The last time I felt warm and fuzzy in a restaurant was in BFG Chicken Strips.  But that's a different review in itself.

I finally got my mouth around the pizza and mmmm mmmm mmmmmmmmmmmm, I realize what my boyfriend meant when he said it tasted so good.  Also, what tasted even better was their garlic knots.  The heavenly taste was just "To Die For!"  Mr. Biaggio you definitely have the right words when you describe your heavenly creations.

After work I decided to treat my boyfriend to Biaggio's Pizzeria and he decided to get the meat lover's pizza while I chose the spaghetti with two meatballs.  The combination of the sauce with the meatballs with the spaghetti sauce tasted like an atom bomb.  

I am definitely a fan and will order only their pizza from now on.  Thanks for an awesome heavenly pizza experience Mr. Biaggio.  :)

You have to eat here!! The food is out of this world. The pizza is fantastic, the pasta dishes are outstanding. When they say that this is the best pizza in Las Vegas, believe them. It is THAT good. Biaggio is right there to make sure everything is okay with the food. He really cares about his guests. I tell everyone that when I pass away I want to be buried with a Biaggio's pizza in my casket.

I ordered a 12'' mushroom pie, breaded mushrooms, and mozzarella sticks. The pizza was very good. I did not enjoy the sides. The cheese in the mozzarella sticks seemed to have harden. I would only recommend pizza from here.

The positive hype is definitely about a local owned and run pizza shop that has great service, great food, and a clean establishment.

I had the chicken pizza which was fantastic. It was followed up with Zeppolis that were beyond explainable. I have been searching for this dish for years and haven't found anyplace that could make them as wonderful as Biaggios. They were fantastic to say the least.

I appreciate great service and great food, thank you Biaggio. It is nice to see owners take pride in their establishment and engage with their clients.

I hate to go against the grain, but as a true pizza connoisseur, it would be wrong to hold back on this one. For reference I've traveled to NYC many, many times, I lived in Chicago for awhile, I've spent a month in Italy and pizza is my favorite food on earth. If I know anything, it's pizza!! I have never been as disappointed in a slice as I was here. 

I do laugh when I read Vegas yelper complaints about brick oven places having "burnt" pizza. In NYC, many order their pizza extra well done and relish in the beautiful black bubbles that a true NYC pizzeria coal fired oven delivers. The crust here was the most bland tasteless cardboard crust I've ever had. I like crust with flavor and this crust had none. It wasn't chewy, it wasn't crispy, it was just blah. 

I thought Metro had the greasiest cheese in town until I tried Biaggio's. I've attached a picture of the disgusting pool of orange that oozed out of every bite. I know some are way into the whole grease thing, but I am not. If you're the type that wants neon orange grease dripping down your arms, this is your place. 

In fairness, I did order the lunch special (2 slices and drink for around 5 or 6 bucks), so perhaps the pizza just doesn't reheat well and I should have ordered a fresh pie? Definitely hands down the most tasteless greasy pizza I've ever had (yup, I'm including Sbarro and Little Caesar's in that!). This pizza may be appealing to some, but this isn't anything like the pizza served in NY.

Disclaimer: my rating is SOLELY for the pizza.

First the positives. As many here have said the owner is a really nice guy, very friendly and clearly proud of his restaurant. The garlic knots are insanely tasty - had I just eaten them, my rating would have two extra stars.

Now onto the pizza. It's disgusting. The crust tastes like cardboard...with less flavor. I've eaten bad pizza before, but I've at least been able to get an entire piece down. It was all I could do to get 2/3 of one slice down.

Another thing that irked me - and this could've been only because I was so dissatisfied with the pizza - was that the waitress was TOO on top of things. She was at my table every 3 bites of food asking how it was, if she could bring us anything etc. While trying to eat a meal and have a nice post work, Friday evening conversation, I felt like I had an unwanted guest at my table. Again, this was likely due to me being upset with the pizza quality, but none the less, it was enough for me to notice it being annoying.

Excellent NY Style Pizza!  Very good appetizers, especially the mushrooms. Every ingredient even the salads use only the very best. The service was also very strong. Highly recommended, they do deliver.

Excellent food, Excellent service! This is our favorite local pizza shop. The owner and family treat you like family, making sure you are completely taken care of. The pizza, salads and garlic knots are just outstanding!

I ordered gluten free pizza.  Good crust, good taste.  I paid for extra cheese.  You could still see through the cheese on my pizza.  It didn't even seem to have REGULAR cheese.  By the time I paid for my one gluten free pizza, it was over $30.  Meh.
Loved the sauce! Awesome service as well. We came from the NJ/NY area and were very pleased with the plain pie we ordered. Would go back.
Great food, really enjoyed my time over. the place might be small with not much stuff on the wall but who needs that. I cam for the pizza and loved it,

Yes truly a hidden gem!! We are returning customers over the years for a reason!! Each pizza is a specialty when it comes to this pizzeria! Love the fresh ingredients and wonderful crust! And let me tell you the salads are amazing too...especially the veggie salad with their special Italian dressing! We always feel extra special when greeted by the owner because you can tell he cares about his menu and his customer service!!  Thank you Mr. Biaggio for offering us great service and really good food!!

If you are searching for a great atmosphere and great food look no further!! I'm pretty obsessed with ranch on pizza, but let me tell you that you won't need it for this pizza! By far one of the best in Vegas!! I would recommend the meat lovers. The owner makes the meatballs and sausage in-house!

Absolutely Love The Art of Chicken Pizza. And they let us split the pizza to accommodate our different tastes. Portions and topping are generous. Well worth the 26 mile drive. Wow!  The owner and his staff were some of the nicest people. The decor is comfortable and very clean. Could have used soft music instead of Television for entertainment. But that might just be me. Other than that, it was perfect. Thank you.  It was great meeting you. We will be back.

The best pizza I've ever eaten!!  Service is personal and outstanding. Highly recommend!!!

Wide variety of choices including specialty pizzas. Veggie pizza is made with fresh vegetables! Have subs, calzones and strombolis, salads, and lots more.

When I need a place to just get away, this is my hide-away.  Shhh... don't give away my secret.

Ok, I'm over this place without a doubt. The wings tasted old with bad fryer oil. The pizza meat was nasty, and the zeppoles, which used to be little pillows tasted like fishy dough balls. We have ordered here for years upon years. This was always an old faithful go-to; even though we knew we would pay more for the product . As nice as our delivery guy was, he broke my credit card when he went to swipe my card. He said the owner would be in touch with me, but I haven't heard a peep.

I'm a native New Yorker and I was very happy with the quality of the food here, I will likely eat here once a week while I'm in Vegas.  The place was extremely clean, the people were gracious, the pricing was fair and the service was fast.

My husband works near here so I yelped to find a pizza place we could try on his lunch break.  My search led me to Biaggio's and I'm thrilled that it did!  

The restaurant is not big but it has a nice, inviting feel to it.  Big booths and comfortable seating.  The display case showcases pizza pies, specialty slices, drinks, and their Boar's Head products (hubby's favorite).  

It was the owner, Biaggio himself, who greeted us with a smile and a, "thanks for stopping in."  This was just our first taste of the excellent service we received.  

We chose a booth and received drinks immediately.  My husband was between a meatball hero and the Secret BLT that he had seen on the website.  He ultimately went with the BLT, we ordered garlic knots, and a small cheese pie.  

It took a little while for our food to arrive, but worth the short wait!  The garlic knots were perfectly soft with a crisp and the marinara sauce was delicious.  My husband LOVED his BLT.  The pizza was very satisfying... and you all know by now that I'm a NY'er and my pizza standards are high.  I'm also not losing my touch for recognizing a good slice.  The crust was fantastic - it was crispy and crunchy but foldable and, to some NY'ers, if you can't comfortably fold it it's a total deal breaker.

Oh!  And I almost forgot to mention the zeppoles.  Now, they're not as light and fluffy as I remember them back at my stomping grounds.   But they are deliciously smothered in powdered sugar and served with a raspberry dipping sauce as well as a vanilla(?) sauce that creates a delightfully sweet raspberries and cream dip.  Biaggio took the time to tell us the best way to dip (first in the raspberry and then in the creamy vanilla dip) and this combo was delectable.  My husband preferred to eat them without the dip but he's not a "sweets" person.  

I can't speak on the taste of this, but I noticed that they offer gluten free options, and I know this is often hard to come by.  

The owner came by to check on us a couple of times with a very delightful and friendly demeanor.  I felt like an old friend of the restaurant, not a first-time customer.  My husband told the owner that he was initially between the BLT and the meatball hero, which he had surmised was the best around based solely on yelp reviews.  My husband mentioned that he hadn't found a fully satisfying meatball hero since moving here and was looking forward to trying it next time.  Moments later Biaggio returned with a plate in hand and gave my husband a Biaggio's meatball to try.  What a nice gesture and we were so excited to try it.  It was incredible, and I'm not even a meatball person.  

Delivery in the valley is tricky.  Not everyone does it and, when they do, you're not sure where they'll deliver to.  Biaggio's delivers ALL OVER the valley.  Want to try it but live in Henderson??  Go for it.  They promise your food will be deliciously hot and fresh when it arrives.  

Can't wait to return to you, Biaggio's!  Thank you for the kind and hospitable service and delicious eats.

Omg I think this is the best pizza in town!!! We had a large 1/2 meat lovers and 1/2 supreme. And yes it was perfect. The toppings are not the cheap kind. Perfect crust and sauce. Also tries the garlic knots. Yum!! And we met the owner. He was very friendly and even offered drinks while waiting for our pizza.

A little expensive but amazing pizza and worth every penny! 
The place is very clean and Biaggio is a great host

Enthusiasm is infectious and the owner of Biaggio is not lacking in that. A simple dinner after grabbing a few drinks turned into an educational forum on the process of pizza making and the care put into each item.

For some, this would be considered badgering, but I find it endearing. This man is proud of the product that he showcases, and rightfully so, minus our initial mistake. We had ordered the fries($3.50) to munch on while we waited for our pizza. Poor choice, because the serving was ridiculously small for the price. We had ordered the medium veggie pizza ($16.25) and I was hoping not to regret it. Thank goodness the next dish salvaged my waning interest. The owner came by to tell us some facts about the ingredients. The dough is made without sugar while the sauce does not use sugar or salt. The taste was simple and clean, a way a good pizza should be. The ingredients were fresh and had individual distinct flavors. The crust was magnificent; possessing a crisp snap and browned to perfection. Save room for dessert because the zeppoles ($3.25) are worth holding off for. The mountainous stack of bite sized pieces brought to mind an allusion to fluffy white clouds leading to Mt. Olympus. (Don't judge, Greek and Roman gods are one in the same.) Simply ambrosial with the raspberry and coconut glaze dipping sauces. The combination of both creates a wonderful pina colada taste. 

On our way out, the owner told us to take a menu because they deliver all over the valley. Before we could inquire, he emphasized our area. So if you live in the Southwest and don't want to travel, this is an option. Just order enough to cover the trip charge.

Holy Stromboli!

Enough said.  Stromboli is awesome.

My wife brought home the Meatball Stromboli.  I didn't get to try it until the next day, reheated, and it was still great if not better than fresh.  I always thought I didn't really like Stromboli until I tried the one at Biaggio's Pizzeria.  Now I'm a believer.

This is the perfect pizza place with the best pizza ever.  Located in a beautiful suburb of Las Vegas but so worth the trip.  If you miss rush hour it is only 15 minutes from downtown and worth the trip.  My son had the meat lover's pizza.  A beautiful looking pizza that tastes even better than it looks and that's saying a lot.  The sausage we were told was from a old family recipe as were the meatballs.  You have never had sausage like this sausage. My wife had the white pizza and it was delicious too.  I always have pepperoni and olive which was delicious but I think this menu needs to be explored.  Wish I was a local.   We finished the meal by splitting cheesecake to die for.  The cheesecake alone is worth the trip.
If you want to get away from the casinos and tourist food and have some real food in a family restaurant, jump in the car, get away from the casino madness, and enjoy a great meal at Biaggio's.    As we sat there it was clear that they treat everybody that comes in as family.  Don't miss it.

Eating in Vegas can be a bit of a challenge with a large group. Following a hockey game, my team was hungry. We stumbled upon this location thanks to Yelp.

The owner was there and they did a great job of serving us quickly and the food was plentiful. 

The highlight of the meal was the meatballs. Many reviews have said that it's a great pizza. I thought it was just average but it may be compared to other Vegas places. The toppings were good and the service was outstanding.

Been here before, had a great experience than, and this time was just as good.  We started  with an Italian sub for an appetizer, it's loaded with meat, red peppers, good bread.  

We also got a meatball, sausage, mushroom and ricotta cheese pizza, it was soooo... good!  We wanted to eat more, but didn't want to look like pigs, so we asked for a box to take home, but it didn't last long!  

Still a hidden diamond in my neighborhood, definitely recommend it.
Was here on a perfect spring day in April.Excellent Pizza all around good crust, sauce and fresh flavor. Overall a great experience

This is our 4th time ordering pizza at Biaggio's. The first 2 times were quite good and I would've definitely recommended them to our friends & family. The owner was friendly and was very welcoming on both occasions. The 3rd and now our 4th time ordering and I'd be hard pressed to go back or recommend them to anyone.

This time we ordered a pizza with mushrooms & ricotta cheese. When I arrived to pick it up I looked at the pizza and voiced my concern that the lack of mushrooms was disappointing and the same thing had happened previously on our 3rd order. The guy at the counter said "I'll write it down" as if that was going to take care of anything with the immediate situation. I was rather puzzled by his response but didn't feel like arguing with him about what good customer service was and how he should've handled the situation.

After arriving home from a quick 5 minute drive we found our pizza to be an undercooked cheesy swamp and as noted before a distinct lack of mushrooms. The pizza was impossible to eat in any normal sense of the word and wouldn't even stand up to the folded NY style of eating a slice. I've attached 2 pictures, bad iPhone shots, showing our pizza and what it looked like prior to and after trying to remove a slice after using a knife to re-cut it.

We were very disappointed as we really liked the flavor of their sauce and the ingredients. Even though it's priced quite high for pizza we would've been regular customers but if you can't get the order right, or cooked properly, I'll spend my money elsewhere.

This place is totally amazing. Their food is off the charts good. The white pizza is my favorite but I think that there could be a little more ricotta on it. But that could just be the fatty in me speaking. Regardless, its damn good.

Excellent service & awesome pizza!  We had the breakfast pizza this time & it was delicious.   The strombolis are to die for.  We usually get the meat lovers.  They never dissapoint with anything we've ordered!  Also best zeppoles in town!

I love this place! Every item I've had on the menu has always been fresh and so delicious! Not to mention, the owner Biaggio is incredibly welcoming and is always seeking to please his customers. The environment is clean and cozy. I highly recommend you stop by and try out this place, you will not be disappointed!
OMG!   This pizza was bomb.   I had it door dashed to work and EVERYONE loved it!  So good.  A little pricy but amazing!   I'll 100% order again!   Seriously you gotta try this place!

Best Pizza in Las Vegas (that I've found so far)

Oddly their 4 cheese pizza is just 4 cheeses- no sauce. 
Ordered without Gorgonzola, and with sauce: it's perfection.

I always try the white pizza but don't quite fancy it. 

They also have delicious tiramisu although a little on the sweet side (that's usually how it is with premade Ladyfingers but I've no idea of their preparation methodology) Good cheesecake as well.

I ordered 4 pizzas and a catering size salad for my daughters birthday. I've never ordered from here before so I went based on reviews. It was amazing! Everyone kept talking about how great the pizza was! We got 2 cheese, 1 veggie, and 1 meat lovers. There were no leftovers which I take as a great sign!! The staff was so friendly and helpful to us. Great little hidden gem we found! It's our new go to delivery pizza!!
best pizza in vegas!!! never tasted pizza like this before, its not just another pizzeria its very clean and great service! TRY IT!!!
Worst pizza I have had in years with pre made frozen crusts - service was slow.  Plenty of alternatives close by
First time experience found them on yelp ordered a meat lovers pizza for delivery pizza came on time and piping hot delicious pizza I will order from them again prompt and courteous service

First order on Yelp! delivery! The menu is nice and extensive. You can order wings individually. Lots of nice pizza options. We ordered a cheese pizza, light sauce, side salad, chicken wings, and a Stromboli. The pizza was hot, cheesy, and the taste was good! The wings were cooked perfectly and I appreciate that we didn't get a ton of drumettes. The Stromboli was literally the size of my husbands forearm! It was way too much food for our family and we had leftovers for 3 days. My only disappointment was the salad, but it wasn't a huge deal. It had no flavor and the house Italian dressing had no flavor, so it was like eating an oily, watery moosh. Overall we would definitely give them another try.

It hurts to write this update.  Biaggio and his staff are super friendly and will bend over backwards to get things right.  Maybe this just wasn't their night last week.  But it still shows how far they'll go for customer satisfaction.   

7:45pm: We feel like a pizza.  Just moved closer to Biaggio and the last 2 experiences we had there were good so what the heck.  I order a large supreme with extra cheese.  The lady over the phone tells me it'll be ready in 20 minutes.  

8:10pm: I arrive and the cook informs the cashier he hasn't even started my order yet.  She seems shocked.  There was some grumbling back there with Biaggio and the staff.  Biaggio come up to me and apologizes profusely for the mishap, gives me my $23 back and said he would take care of me the next time as well.  I didn't think it was that big a deal and did not make a stink over it at all.  I said it would not be necessary to take care of me on the next trip and tipped $3 to the staff.  The pizza comes out unusually fast and I go home.

8:27 and 24 seconds:  Arrive home and bring the pizza to the dining table and my wife takes the first bite.  The green peppers are COLD.  The pizza is not even warm and the consistency of the cheese is weird.  It was as if the cook took a cheese pizza that had been sitting out for a while and attempted to reheat it with the toppings he just added.  I thought I could just ignore all this and eat it but after half a slice, I called the restaurant and explained the situation.  The cashier offers to deliver a hot one to my house at no additional cost.  Fine!  Why would the cook think he could get away with giving me that first pizza?  Did he just think we wouldn't notice?  It was kind of offensive.  I've never returned a pizza ever before!  I couldn't believe it. 

9:03: New hot pizza arrives and it's definitely oozing with cheese.  It doesn't have as much pepperoni or sausage but still way better than the first one.  The thing was that this new pizza was NOT five stars.  Not even close.  I could rattle off 5 other places off the top of my head that were better than this.         

But the service, effort and attempt to do right is what saves it from giving them 2 stars.  I honestly believe this could've been just a bad night but I hadn't eaten there in over a year and won't give it five stars if it doesn't deserve it and tonight it certainly did not.  I am coming back for wings and pastrami but on the border for pizza.

Loved this place. Finally made the trip after hearing all my friends rave about it. Sauce is incredible! No salt or sugar in the sauce makes it extra friendly. Pizza is to die for and the meatballs?? Forget about it! My new favorite place to eat!

I am not impressed. The pizza, garlic knots, meatballs zeppole were decent, but nothing to write home about. 

The worst part was the spaghetti and meatballs dinner I ordered. I asked for sauce on the side, which they did. But they gave me a minuscule portion of spaghetti (not even enough for a child's portion IMO and it was hard and had obviously been sitting. There was literally more sauce than pasta. 

The side salad with grilled chicken is $3 more than without, so I assumed they must give a decent sized piece of chicken with it. You know what they say when you assume, right? There was maybe half a cutlet's worth or pre-frozen, microwave grilled chicken (think McDonald's kind) on it. 

So all in all, I paid almost $20 ($12 for the spaghetti and $7 for the salad) for what amounts to a child's portion of food (half of which was inedible). We got the food maybe 30 minutes before closing, so when I called to let them know I figured we could just work it out next time (we were happy with everything else) but the phone just rang and rang. We will definitely go somewhere else next time.

Love love love this place!! Having lunch with my buddy Barb enjoying some heat outside....relaxing eating great pizza my choice is the pepperoni or meatball with jalapeños! The owner is friendly and funny!

One of my favorite delivery places in town.  I have no idea why, but they literally deliver anywhere in the area.  They know that they are getting good word of mouth through Yelp, seem to know if you are a yelper, and go the extra mile to make sure they get a 5 star review.

I will be honest though, I have not personally ordered pizza for myself from Biaggio's, mainly because I love their chicken wings.  Yes they are lightly breaded, but they give a light crisp and travel well.  They are also smart enough to carry the hot sauce on the side without asking.

My husband however, really loves the pizza, stromboli, and occasionally a calzone.  The calzone sometimes does not travel well, so be forewarned, especially if you order a meat lovers as my husband does.  It can get occasionally greasy.

Delivery Review:

Im gonna be honest idk what most of the reviews here are talking about. I cannot think of any particular reason why the pizza here is anything above just straight average and ultimately forgettable.

Delivery time was fair around 45 minutes. The major benefit of Biaggio's is that it seems to have no location restrictions for delivery. Their location is in West Las Vegas and they are willing to deliver to the strip. That is definitely a plus. 

-Meat Lovers Pizza. Okay and nothing greater than that. Toppings, cheese, and sauce were all fine. The crust is definitely not. It is about as bland as it can come.

-White Pizza. Tried to order it with alterations and did not receive any. Again just average white pizza. Not enough garlic. Fairly bland.

It's not worth its own price points at all. It's more expensive than a chain pizza restaurant and definitely not any better. I can only rate pizza delivery in comparison to typical delivery chains. Biaggio's is NOT better than a pizza hut or a domino's. And Im not saying I like either of those chains that much because I don't. But does it justify straying away from the garlic knot stuffed crust at Pizza Hutt? Certainly not. Can it compete with Pizza Rock? Certainly not.

Skip!

Best pizza and service ever! The marinaded tomatoe and Ricotta cheese pizza is full of flavor and delicious to the last bite! They will make a pizza or salad any way you like, and they want you to be happy with what you get.  Biaggios is truly a home away from home!

Not only was our pizza exceptional, fresh ingredients, delicious dough, sauce, CHEESE...but the lady behind the counter (maybe an owner) asked if my 2 year old daughter would like the same pizza or something else- she of course took one look at the artichokes and said "No, I want that one!", pointing at a picture of pepperoni pizza on the wall. The lady (sorry I didn't get her name) said "Can I warm up a slice of pepperoni for her?" and then she asked my daughter if she wanted some juice too. I offered to pay but she refused, said she remembered when her kids were that young.
 They helped me juggle the boxes out to the car when they saw my daughter wanted to be carried.

What an amazing family restaurant.

Definitely our go-to pizza choice!

Already looking forward to our next pizza night!

Okay, so opinions of good pizza vary from person to person, and opinions of good wings vary from person to person.  I love Biaggio's wings.  Love.  I mean, we will go out of our way to get those delicious wings.  Some people like really wet, soggy wings.  Don't come here if that's what you want.  I like my wings EXACTLY how Biaggio's makes them: smaller and crispy, soft inside, great sauce.  They know how to do it perfectly.  Every time.  

The pizza is pretty good too.  They have great sauce and cheese.  The garlic knots are amazing.  

I'm giving 5 stars based on everything overall, including service.  Biaggio himself is always there.  He's very involved with the food that goes out.  He's always upbeat and personable, which goes a long way in my book.  My husband and I have been going to his restaurant for a long time now.  

It's definitely worth your time to go there.  Great service and food!

Great local pizzeria!

We were having a hard time trying to find a place to have an end of season party for our soccer team.  Finally came across Biaggio's and gave them a call to see if they could help us out.  

The owner and staff were very friendly and more than accommodating.  The food was great - parents and kids alike loved it!  There was more than enough and everything was ready promptly for us.

Thanks, Biaggio's, for a great party for our group!

Best pizza I've had in Vegas. Worth the drive off the strip. Pizza is delicious from the first bite to the crust. As a pizza lover, you can tell this place uses top quality ingredients that doesn't brake the bank. Will definitely be coming back on our next Vegas trip.

Fantastic place for pizza, calzones, meatball sandwich. We came here for lunch (thanks to yelp) and the rating defenatly matches their food. My kids fell in love with the garlic knots and could not get enough of their pizza as well. We will be coming back for sure.

We got there around 7:30 PM. The shop was busy since there was a party of 10 and only 2 servers. I usually don't eat Fettuccine but Chicken Alfredo Fettuccine was very good. Mozzarella sticks were chewy and delicious. The Meatlover pizza was good but a bit expensive for its quality.

The only thing I can't bear was the spaghetti sauce. It had weird taste and I couldn't explain how. It wasn't sweet and tasty. I'm not sure if it was original Italian spaghetti sauce but it wasn't good to me.

I think this restaurant is a bit overpriced for the pizzas. We ended up paying $80 for 1 medium pizza, 2 dishes of spaghetti, 1 fettuccine and 1 mozzarella stick dish. I will come back for the Fettuccine.

I am not a huge fan of pizza but one bite of a Biaggio slice made me a fan. I picked my own toppings for the pizza and I order the small size and I still had left overs. Fast service. Incredible staff. If you are lucky, you will get to chat with the owner. He's absolutely adorable. Great guy.

Best pizza I've ever had. Everything is great! Fried mushrooms, garlic knots, calzone, pizza, & cheesecake. The owner really makes this place the best. A genuine person! 3rd time coming to eat since I found this place 24 hours ago. 
I suggest dinning in to meet the owner and the friendly staff.

What a hidden gem. I'm Gluten Free, and finding a delicious GF chicken Parm, and Ravioli is amazing enough, but the sauce is also sugar free and salt free (although your taste buds would never know). The owner himself (The smiling guy with the shaved top) is also GF, and takes great pride in creating safe, healthy, delicious cuisine for his clientele. I will be back, and I'll be bringing my friends (GF or not) with me again and again.

We have eaten here many times, the food and service is amazing every time.  Tried the fettuccini alfredo for the first time today, absolutely the best I have ever had.  Our 7 year old was stealing it off my plate.  My husband is gluten free and he loves their gluten pizza and gluten free cheese balls.  Very happy customer, I tell everyone they have to try it!

Went to pick up a pizza for national pizza day and wasn't disappointed.  We had a medium which was more than enough for two. Had spinach, green bell peppers, meatballs and ricotta for the pizza toppings it was so good everything tasted fresh. Excited to try all the other yummy things I'm sure they have.

Pretty darn good pizza here!!! The have a special everyday I believe which is 2 slices of pizza and a drink for around 8 bucks! Soo good ! Also have calzones and is connected to an Italian restaurant next door called raggianos

I found this place at Yelp and drive more than 15 minutes from strip. I didn't regret most of my choice, because everything was perfect. Excellent customer service, affordable prices, super tasty pizza and salad. Thank you so much!

Where can I start..... We were in town from Salt Lake for a paintball tournemnt and wanted something other then fast food or chain restaurants. We found Biaggie's on here (Yelp) and decided to give it a try. Not just the best pizza in town...BEST PIZZA I HAVE EVER HAD!! From the garlic knots, to the amazing supreme pizza, ending with the out-of-this-world New York cheesecake with raspberry drizzle that tasted homemade!!!! I couldn't eat anymore but had to get some knots to go!!! Thank you for the amazing customer service and amazing food!!! Next time we are in town we will for sure be stopping by Biaggie's!!

Maybe we tried them on an off night. Ordered mild chicken wings, while they were cooked right they were more like plain. Ordered the pizza extra crispy, but it arrived soggy with undercooked toppings - I think it would have been tasty if it hadn't been so soggy. We had Spagetti with Sausage and I think my hubby had Chicken Parmesan. Red sauce wasn't anything to write home about, not nearly as good as our old Italian home delivery spot from La Famiglia on Durango.  The search for our weekend italian delivery joint continues.

1st timer... 2 slice Lunch special w drink. 

Good deal.

Their pizza is good; I think the ingredients are high quality and fresh (I had a medium with pineapple and mushroom). Thankfully--it's definitely not cheap, so it's good to actually get your money's worth. The people working there are friendly, too. Definitely worth checking out.
Awsome, the "Art of Chicken" Pizza is truly a work of art, the combination of flavors is music to the tastebuds!

I read the reviews on Yelp about Biaggio's and decided to try it. The owner waited on me. While I was waiting for my Stromboli to come up, he generously gave me a slice of cheese pizza and a coke.  I found this highly unexpected, and very kind. He had me with his generosity, but after trying the meatball Stromboli, he really had me. The Stomboli was incredible!!! I can hardly wait to try some of the other items that people are recommending here.

I am a pizza nut. Self admitted, I need help, nut. I couldn't believe how hard it is to find pizza in Vegas that suits my taste. 

THIS IS IT! Phenomenal, fresh ingredients. Elegant, intricate yet classic flavors. Friendly, impeccable service. 

Garlic knots: Sweet, large,  buttery, garlic not overpowering. Served with great marinara, not some tomato sauce affair.

Greek Salad: perfect vinaigrette, feta that was like it was flown in today, crisp, impeccable.

Italian Sub: usually not my cup of tea. I guess I never had a good one before! The wife ordered it, and I almost stole it from her! Unbelievably well dressed and loaded.

The Pizza: Oh, the pizza. HOMEMADE meatball slices. Dough that was the soul of perfection. Not salted to heck and gone  to make you drink more soda. Perfect compliment of flavors. 

Zeppole: Never had it before. OMG. The same delicate pizza dough fried, the blanketed in powdered sugar, served with berry dip, then a custard dip. (Did in order as instructed.) Like the best powdered doughnut you've ever had in your life, only fresh and warm. If you hadn't of told me they were fried, I would not have ever guessed that. 

Overall, I can totally see why so highly reviewed. We will be back, again and again!

A total value!!! You'll find cheaper. But you'll not find better.

First thank you for the kind hospitality when I visited you last Tuesday for lunch. I do not give away 5 stars lightly. I had a meatball sub and a slice of pizza. The meatball was out of this world good. Packed with flavor and excellent density with moisture through out.  The pizza was the best I have had in years. I have spent a lot of my career on the east coast and I would put this pizza against anything I have had there. 

Thank you again and keep on making excellent food.

Molto Bene!

First my disclaimer.  Lost my good phone about 8 months ago and not able to upgrade for too long.  My non-contract phone was a POS and thus terminating my mobile social media habit.  So, I have not been doing my due-deligence as a proud Yelper.

Did the Pumpkinman triathlon a few weeks back and it wooped on my pretty bad.  I got home beat tired (I live off of Rochelle and Ft. Apache).  I was really craving spagethi of all things.  I rarely  venture east of Ft. Apache and I just could not think of a place to eat but was starved.  

DUH.  Yelp it.

I was using PASTA as the keyword and Biaggio's does not come up in the top three I think because his specialty is pizza.  I saw some things down on Rainbow but I really did not want to drive that far.  I saw this Ft. Apache address and I was mystified by the map.  How in the hell could this be across the street from me (walking distance if I wasn't so tired)?

As I was pulling into the parking lot, I noticed some people leaving with bikes on their racks and it was easy to surmise they had probably just finished Pumpkinman which was a good sign.

I walked in and the way the place is laid out you are not quite sure if you are supposed to be seated or go up to the counter.  (both options are acceptable)  I walked up to the counter to minimize the meet and greet steps and ordered some spaghetti.  Biaggio was like, "ok, how about some meatballs?"  I was like ok, whatever but I really just wanted the pasta.  Biaggio then says " I am going to just give you a piece of pizza...what kind do you want?"  Pepperoni and sausage would be great.

I sat down in a booth and looked at the great images of his pizzas and realized he is all about his pizzas.  I was served quick enough considering this is not microwave chow, and the presentation was beautiful.  (see my pix).  The one slice was almost enough but then the spaghetti came and I was golden.  But, hold on....Yes, the meatballs were incredible.  By the time I gorged myself, did a yelp and Facebook checkin, sent my photos to all my friends, had a nice little chat with Biaggio.  He is one cool kat.

Can hardly wait to return to the scene of my crime (by not eating here in the last 4 years I have lived across the street from the restaurant).  I would high recommend and also chat it up with everyone there.  Friendly peeps.

Ok... driving up I didn't have high hopes.  Walking in it was clean but empty and again I  didn't have high hopes.

Give this place a chance!   Turns out it was probably the best Italian American (settabello has my napolitano pizza heart) I have had in Vegas.   

Not only was it delicious but we got great service from the owner.   Yes you could say that was because we were the only ones in there but you could tell that he really cared. 

And they have gluten free!   I'm definitely coming back!

Last day in Vegas did not know if we wanted breakfast or lunch since it was 11:30 am. I started craving good pizza drove about 30 off the strip was a great decision best fresh made pizza. We tried one of the meatballs melted like butter in my mouth. Just like the saying goes, "was the juice worth the squeeze" definitely!!!
Some of the best Italian pizza I've ever had in Vegas and good customer service. 5 stars

Excellent pizza, garlic knots, fresh fried zuchini w/ ranch... Truly great Italian food. Hidden gem but because of Yelp found and discovered;) We have eaten in & taken out. Food tasted great either way.
Huge gluten free variety, personable staff, fantastic food. All very homestyle. I left very impressed. A small culinary treasure.

We love this place!  The combination pizza is fantastic. You can get two slices of pizza and a drink for $5.99. The owner is the nicest guy ever!  He gave a homeless guy a meal while we were there. Great food!

On my latest outing here I was hankering for my favorite meal, Spaghetti & Meatballs, besides wanting to dive into a superior New York style pizza.  So I didn't refrain from ordering both.

A fine side salad with Italian Dressing got things off to a nice start.  This was then followed by a large portion of Spaghetti & Meatballs, seasoned with onions, and well executed with fine saucy flavoring.  And, the Pepperoni, Mushroom, & Sliced Tomato Pizza with Grande Cheese that immediately followed was suitably saucy and cheesy, and adorned with all fresh and tasty toppings.  Moreover, the perfectly cooked pizza crust was of the thin variety while still allowing for chomping toothsome bites, and individual slices were nice and springy when hand held.

It was a very satisfying dinner, as well as a reheated pizza lunch at home the next day!

I've been a customer of Biaggio's for a few years but sadly I will no longer be doing business with them. When I first found Biaggio's, they really had the best pizzas in the SW Vegas area. The pizzas were delicious and you could tell that they were made with good ingredients. They were also reasonably priced. What made this place even more convenient was that you could order online instead waiting on hold (this place would get busy during meal times). However, in the last year or so the quality has declined. The pizzas were still decent but almost every time I would order there would be mistakes. Regardless if the order was placed over the phone or online, some how some way the order would end up being incorrect and my wife and I would have to wait 30+ minutes for the correct order to be delivered (anyone who has been in this situation can attest to how frustrating this can be especially when you are hungry). At first they used to provide gift certificates and Mr. Biaggio himself would deliver the correct order with a sincere apology but this doesn't happen anymore. The drivers deliver the corrected order and hardly seem apologetic or sympathetic. This place has really declined over the last couple of years and it is saddening because I really used to enjoy their food. Hopefully they can turn things around before more people follow suit and bring their business elsewhere.

From top to bottom, delivers and exceeds expectations!  It may be a small family owned business but you can tell they take pride in their work and they were efficient.  I place the call 20 minutes ahead of time for a pickup, arrived exactly when they said it would be ready.  I was instantly greeted with a smile by the owner and shown this monster of a stromboli...it was a full 2 ft in length!!  I was not expecting that.  Anyway, drove home, cut into it and took a bite of glory...it tasted like Italy had stepped into my living room.  

Definitely check it out!

Visiting from California, seriously the best pizza I've ever had. The white pizza is superb, so I definitely recommend that. The restaraunt is very neat & clean which is always a great thing. The price as well wasn't bad compared to some of the places I looked at on yelp. 

Service was great! The owner was so sweet, came over and talked to us and treated us like friends instead of another person buying some food and shared some info about how he has home made sauce and other such things which makes for great quality pizza. 

Check it out!
Went here for the first time on 9-5-14, the meatball parm hero is every bit as good as others have stated. Their pizza is excellent as well. Highly recommend,  will be back

Biaggios is the absolute best pizza on the west side of town. He has the best doughs, sides and the value you can't beat. The owner is one of the nicest people ever. He definitely tries to take care of you. Definitely recommend!

ive been here quite a few times now in a short period of time. the first time i just tried a couple slices, they were okay (reheated, standard ny pizza) the next couple times were amazing, really really good food, so much so that we (my husband and i) went back days in a row. sadly, the last time we went it was pretty bad... i mean i did read on here that the meatball pizza was inconsistent but c'mon... that was from like a 9.5 to a 1... def wouldnt order the meatball pie again.

we have lived in Las Vegas for forty plus years and as of late have been somewhat disappointed in the world of pizza.  modern pizzas trying to be all things to all people are just not our "thing".  today (saturday) my wife was tired from a hectic week and work and i suggested that we try for a good pizza one more time.  turning to yelp for help in this matter we came upon Biaggio's.  IT WAS AS PROMISED A FIVE STAR PIZZA.  EXCELLENT IN ALL AREAS.  FROM A BEAUTIFUL CRUST TO PROPERLY SPREAD CHEESE (GRANDE). SAUCING WAS GREAT.  PIZZA WAS HOT.  STAFF WAS FRIENDLY WE LOVED IT!!!!!!!!  our new go to place for pizza.. give it a try....

Found this little gem when we were craving for some good pizza and let me tell you, this is some LEGIT pizza. We were surprised to see the place was empty when we came in (but then again, we went on a Sunday night) but we were excited to try this place because of the good reviews on yelp. We tried the large meat lovers pizza ($21.99), garlic knots ($5.99), and fried mushrooms ($5.99) and were not disappointed at all! I didn't get out server's name but he was so kind and welcoming. It was a little of a wait for the food to come out but everything was served hot, delicious, and fresh. Highly recommend if you're in the area! We will definitely be back.

Best gluten free pizza EVER! I have loved on Vegas for 4 years and always saw this place as it is literally across the street from the entrance to my neighborhood but never tried it as I have Celiacs Disease. One day while family was in town everyone wanted pizza so we tried it out. To my suprize they had gluten free pizza and it was the best I have ever eaten. I have tried numerous gf pizzas in vehas to include Mark Rich's which was gross, BJs also gross and CPK ( they no longer make gf crust)

Biaggio and his business partner are the nicest people and genuinely care about the quality of the food served. If you go and don't like it they will make it right. 

What are you waiting for? Go try it and tell them Brittany sent you!

Probably one of the better pizza places in town in my opinion... great cheese, good sauce, and a thin cracker like crust. I see alot of complaints about the prices, but consistency and quality cost money, and i dont mind paying extra knowing im getting both every time.
I've never had anything I didn't like! It's the best pizza we've come across in Vegas. The calzones are ginormous and the salads are just as big.

We were leaving Vegas and looking for a good pizzeria off The Strip for the whole family and Yelp pointed us to Biaggios and we couldn't have been happier.  The pizza was excellent, they were more than tolerant of our loud kids and the owners couldn't be nicer. It's several miles east of the strip, but if you are looking for a reasonably priced meal away from the hullabaloo, this is a great choice. We'll definitely check in the next time we come back.

The pizza at this place is amazing! Great service, desserts are sinfully delicious (fried dough OMG). Great Greek salad, little pricey but good. Chicken parm was overdone but pretty good. Will definitely eat here again.


Edit! Service from the "manager" not so great. The pizza is to die for though. I wish they had a place in the Bay Area.

I absolutely love their pizza!! And I love that they are gluten free, only downside is that they are a little pricey and when my boyfriend ordered from them the guy on the phone was rude and overcharged is for our pizza! Other than that I've had great experiences.
Still the best pizza in town!!!! We can never get enough.  We would rather drive 8 miles out of our way than settle for a cheap knockoff!!

I found Biaggio's off of yelp and had lunch here after taking my moms dog to the vet the other day. The reviews and ratings just do not do proper justice for this place. First, the food was great, and the lunch special was cheap too! Definitely get the garlic knots, but above the food I want to mention the service. I saw more compassion in my twenty minuet lunch than I did the better part of this year. The gentlemen that worked there was so friendly and a great server, but more so just a kind person. A man came in who was having trouble with his motor functions, the man who worked there helped him walk over to his table, returned the change to this patrons pocket when he couldn't and just went so far beyond what was required of his job. That made my day more so than the food. If you don't give this place a shot, you're the one missing out in more ways than one.

This place was just ok. 

I was feeling lazy and wanted to get some delivery. Browsing through reviews on Yelp, I was happy to come across this place that delivered and had fantastic reviews. 

We ordered a medium Hawaiian, chicken wings and some onion rings. The onion rings were soggy and gross. I kinda figured they would be from that long drive to my place, so I blame myself for that choice. The pizza was very underwhelming. I was so disappointed after reading all the rave reviews. The crust was blah, the toppings were blah, the only saving grace was the flavorful tomato sauce. The highlight of the meal were the chicken wings. They were really good. Great texture and flavor. The bleu cheese dressing that came with them wasn't great, but we just ended up dipping them in the hot sauce instead and yum. 

Overall, not the greatest place, but it'll do in a pinch.

The food is delicious. A bit pricey ,but each bite was worth it. The garlic knots were so yummy and pizza great. My husband and I are from California and looking for a new pizza joint out of strip. this was the best decision we made trying this place

You know how they say the "Holes in the Wall" have the best food. That stands true to this restaurant. The decor inside is super cute and very clean. The only negative thing I can say about this place is that they don't have one closer to my side of town. 

I got two pieces of pepperoni pizza and some garlic knots, all of which was delicious. The service was also great.

I am from Brooklyn, New York, and I approve of this Pizzeria. I am very picky with my pizza growing up in NY, although Biaggio's is the best New York Pizza in Vegas, hands down. Mr. B, the owner, has a true passion for pizza and it definitely shows!!

I was really torn as to how to score this place, so I decided to score the pizza rather than the overall experience. 

I was craving pizza one night, and I haven't lived in this side of town for very long. Yelpers seem to love this place, so I tried it out. The pizza was hot and fresh and really fantastic. Just as I like it...not too thick or thin, the perfect amount of sauce, and quality toppings. However, there is only one size, so if you're eating alone and don't want to/can't eat it all yourself, it's a waste. It is also really expensive for a meal for one. If it had been earlier in the evening, I probably would have left without ordering anything, but I was hungry and it was a work night, so I forked out the big bucks and took the leftovers (3/4 pizza) to a friend the next day. Would I go back? Not if I were alone. With friends, maybe.

Amazing gluten free options!!! The pizza is so delicious, the best we've found in Vegas:-) We've had both GF and regular crust, both are great. Desserts are wonderful, cheesecake and cannoli The owner is so thoughtful, the kind of personality that actually adds to the dinning experience. You really should try this place!!
